review: This game is fun but you do need at least one other person that you know personally or that you met in game that you trust. The lonewolf mthod of getting to the top is extremely hard for newcomers raiders and jsut overall game experience cause you need to grind. Having two or more people makes the game more fun in general and can make grinding more interesting. For example if you are getting resources and talking to your friend you could be discussing the game base layouts raid plans etc. But by yourself you are thinking to yourself and feel lonely sometimes. I regret not haveing anyone else that I know play on a computer. Most kids in my school are playing Fortnut on the Xbox and PS4 (looking for a friend). The community can be toxic with people cheating and backstabbing but if you are lucky the game experience will be good. Summary9/10 recommend it bring friend(s) leanr mechanics in low pop server and don't switch servers because the blueprints that you have in one doesn't transfer to the other. I learned this the hard way by only going into one server and got raided. Lost my entire base. Raged and promised myself not to ever go into that server. Went into a different server and needed to start from scratch. It really frustrating when you are near endgame with electricity and stuff.

review: Rust is a hardcore survival game that heavily focuses on pvp elements with pve as flavor. Yes people get clans together to dominate servers but that happens on every game with servers that's within or even remotely similar to the genre. The gunplay is good each map is beautiful and unique and the experiences cam be priceless. Is it worth $34.99? Yeah but I'd grab it on sale or on because why wouldn't you? The best part of this game though is the developers. They released a game on early access and they delivered whole heartedly. FacePunch Studios contiues to update this game every single month with updates on what people in the community are up to as well just to keep everybody a little strung together and in the know on what's poppin. Grab some friends play Rust and have fun. will happen.

review: A great game with literally thousands of hours worth of play time that just becomes the biggest problem with this game for me. Its a time killer. You might struggle to keep up if you havent got much free time to dedicate to this game. Between server wipes and just being raided you need to be online or you lose almost all progression. You also need to keep up with updates and changes which happen every week or 2. The community isnt as toxic as people make out. Modded servers are great. The occasional cheater. Good solo but way better with friends. One of my all time favourite multiplayer games I just dont have the time to sink in to it to get anywhere solo.

review: I actually do love this game it looks like I have more hate for it than love but thats not true. I may not have alot of hours in this game but I do have the understanding of rust's mechanics. I am a guy who mostly loves FPS games since I was a child and this is just a unique one ( off ark)You start with a rock and a torch you hit some tress down get a stone node get a hatchet and pickaxe build a base and then the rest of the path is in your hands its truly magical what the paths can lead up to but it can be a rollercoaster of emotions.What I love Just pop into a server and start doing what u are able to go from nothing to a king having the feeling of winning 1 v 3 battle raid someone and it actually being worth it learn everything once and be able to craft it all the time until the server wipes actually finding someone who won't betray you (super rare like a shiny pokemon) having people around with an actual mic so you can negotiate something getting your first gun is a incredible feeling having a great start in a freshly 100+ player wiped server not dying getting to the dome top or the water treatment plant parkour the bandit camp has been a pretty good addition in my opinion.well I listed everything I really love about rust theres no way its perfect tho.What I HATE in rust 1) Most of the people in a rust server cause they don't ever use a mic2) When exploring barrels you can get blueprints like 5 or so no one needs them JUST ADD MORE RANDOM BLUEPRINTS FFS THAT ACTUALLY HELP 3) Getting raided as a solo player against 3 fully geared guys who know they wont get materials to break even spending 4k of sulfur (kys but to be fair solo players should stick to solo servers5) optimization of the game is aids I play on very weird and mixed up graphics why cant it just be more simple and understanding for everyone?6)I love losing all my progress by a guy with a semi auto in a server that was wiped 5 hrs ago 7) I mean you still may be in denial about it BUT DONT TRUST RANDOM PEOPLE IN RUST ITS JUST A SCIENTIFIC FACT8) Getting outplayed but a guy with worse gear and beating you is super infuriating9)Compound bow is dog thanks. Nailgun is even better.10) You killed a guy who had a custom smg? TOO BAD FOR YOU SMG BODYS ARE SO ING RARE (not rly green crates just look for places with green crates like Dome top or something casual like a supermarket its a 17% chance for it out of them) SEMI BODY'S ARE SO MUCH EASIER TO FIND LIKE CMON.11) as a wise man once said ' YOUR SKINS' fREAKAZOID 2k1512) Some people say some of the dumbest on the planet in this game no joke. (if they even can talk)13) Getting spawned and chased by a guy with a bow.14) random pernament characters I get what the creator wanted to do with this BUT LET US CHOOSE THAT TO SOME EXTENTIf you want to buy the game 1) actually have a good pc 2) store this on SSD ONLY3)if u have money sure buy it full price I would recommend for a sale tho.4) understand that this will make you a sick degenerate person.5) your gonna want to ragequit a lot but never give up.YEEET

review: If the game was still back in it's original BP's and XP stage I wouldn't be able to find fault in this game at all. This is to this day probably the game I've enjoyed most coming on every day and grinding the game for multiple hours on end with friends. It's given me probably the most saddest of times when you farm a full inventory and loose it to a naked with a bow and the greatest times raiding and gaining the best of loot.Atm the stage where it's at the Component/BP stage. It's a game you basically cannot play solo unless you play on a strictly SOLO ONLY server.. Most of the times you'll be killed by 3+ groups while you're roaming around farming or going on scrap runs and it gets pretty frustrating.I would recommend this as a 8/10 for now and i'm still wishing that they renewed the good old bp's.

review: I see a lot of complaints but pretty much everything some people hate about this game is fixed on modded servers. Don't like the grind? Go to a 5x gather rate server. Don't like having to supply your tool cabinet? Go on a no decay server. You want to explore and get used to the game without dying every 5 minutes? Go on a low pop server. You want to log on and instantly go kill someone with a big rock? Join a 300 man server. Whatever playing style you like there's a server for you.But no matter what....expect to die and get raided. I probably was killed 10+ times before I got my first kill. And just remember...just because you're naked and just have a rock doesn't mean you can run up on a guy with assault rifle and kill him. I've done it! I've also been the guy that got taken out by 2 spear chuckers when I had an SMG.

review: The last time I reviewed this game I gave it a thumbs up.Now I can't recommend it anymore.The gameplay is fun and challenging base building is awesome and seeing everyones creativity in how they make their base to counter raiders can be very unique and interesting. For most the climatic moment of this game is when you/your group finally has farmed up enough to which you are loaded with gear weapons ammo and C4 and are reading to go out and raid some major base and have a big battle against the Base Home Owners and counter Raiders. For me the climatic moment of this game is after building my base w/ my group the base being put to the test and defending our loot and home against the army of +5 &gt +10 raiders.However overall the community and the games current state ruins it all... AdvancementWant to be geared up with the top notch guns armor and base defenses?1. Find a AK (very rare) (can take hours)2. Farm up a bunch of scrap (can take up to 30mins)3. Research the gun using a blueprint bench w/ your scrap to guarantee blueprint (gun breaks)4. Farm up supplies to make the AK since the last one broke (also rare) (can take hours)5. Craft your AK!Congrats you have a AK!Now do this process again for the AK ammo(s) (regular explosive high velocity) Pistol ammo(s) Thompson Pump shotgun Shotgun ammo(s) Turret Shotgun trap Bolt rifle Sub gun Semi rifle Rocket launcher Rockets C4 Revolver Python Revolver Semi pistol Chest plate Face mask Bucket helmet Garage doors Giant walls LR 300 (Assault Rifle) M249etc.I think you get the point.Unless you're lucky enough to find the blueprint while you're gathering resources it's going to take days to perhaps even weeks before you get even a fraction of good gear equipment and base defenses. All in which time you will likely get attacked and raided and have to rebuild your base and refarm the resources for upkeep.&gt As a solo player that is. If you're lucky maybe you can find a group of players who already have the blueprints that will get you farmed up. But good luck finding a group to join.Solo playing vs Team playingUnless you're a pro the only way to enjoy this game is with friends.&gt The only way to be successful is if you have a group of +2 players.Good luck finding anyone to team with as no one is looking for teammates.If you do manage to find people to team with there's a chance you may be betrayed by them because they joined another team.As a solo noob player good lucking gathering resources to build your base repair the base keep supplying your tool cupboard to keep your base from decaying away and creating tools/weapons to match the other players around you. You'll never make a base that can defend against the groups of dedicated players that farm up C4 all day and are all geared up. while you are still stuck with crossbows / basic weak gun weaponry. You'll never be able to raid your gear back from those dedicated players when their base is huge filled with traps turrets armored walls/doors large walls surrounding it multilayered walls (hunnycombing) etc. as making just 1 C4 can take forever to get the ingrediants for let alone getting the blueprint to be able to make it in the first place and getting the weapons and armor to match fighting the other groups while also being outnumbered etc.ZergsRust used to have an issue with lots of zergs.&gt Aka groups with mass amounts of players that dominate the server.And some servers still have many zergs.Servers have begun countering this by making server rules that are Solo Duo and/or Trio groups only.But this just leads to a new problem in which you have a hard time finding a group to join since everyone is either already maxed or satisfied and untrusting of bringing in new players to their group.Casual vs Pro/DedicatedIf my previous points haven't made it clear already you can't really play and enjoy this game as a casual. This game is a grind fests. Constant farming to keep your base standing while also trying to advance to be able to match the players who have teammates.Closing ReviewI criticized this game when they removed blueprints in exchange for the XP system in which you unlocked blueprints through farming however before the XP system blueprints were not extremely rare and resources to make equipment / weapons were not rare either.&gt It wasn't quick either but getting everything didn't take weeks of farming (solo player).It seems that with every update the developers are trying to find more ways to make players grind. Trying to slow the pace of the game more and more.I used to hop on this game every few months to see the new updates. I would slave for a group until I earned their trust and I would join that group and assist in raids defending farming etc.Now it seems no one is looking for slaves no one is looking for additions to their team.The game does seem to be taking a direction into PvE by adding NPC Scientists and Bandits along with Outposts giving some sort of civilization which adds a Fallout vibe.&gt Hostile Scientists (Blue Scientists)&gt Bandit Outpost (Friendly NPC Bandits but NOT a Safe Zone) and Military Outpost (Green Scientists / Safe Zone)However the NPCs are currently broken with having perfect accuracy.Plus the Attack Helicopter that has been in the game for a while the Tank etc.I know its cliche as everyone else says the same thing but "the community is toxic".Its very difficult to find anyone to team with so you'll likely be stuck solo unless you have friends who already own the game or plan to buy the game with you.You won't get far solo unless you become a pro and invest the majority of your life to grinding and playing all day and night.I am hoping for the old Rust to come back.&gt Not Legacy as that is already availableBut I am hoping for team finding to become easier in the future and for this grindfest to be toned back down some.In it's current state find some other game. If you don't have friends to play with this game will be a stressful waste of time bore of a grind...

review: Rust It has its ups and downs. While it is a very nice looking game and is fun to play there are a couple negatives to counter it and even the playing field out.Graphics Exceptionally good sunsets are very nice IMO. Large forests and open areas both look beautiful. If you want to pump up your graphics you'll need a pretty nice PC to get acceptable frame rates. Although there are a lot of hardcore players on here to get the best performance PVP wise you need to tweak your graphics to see other players with the best quality.Gameplay Very fun to play with a group of 3 or more. Gives the battlefield more diversity and it allows you to make some admirable plays on enemies. Even larger groups make it hilarious to play as you mostly mess around with eachother and roam. The larger the group the more you dominate. Friendliness is a give and take. Too much friendliness leads to you losing most of your items and gets you killed. But enough friendliness lets you team up with others and can lead to some pretty cool raids or PVP fights. Be careful who you team up with though. Lots of backstabbers in this game that are selfish for loot.This game requires a mid tier amound of farming but that depends on what kind of server you play. The server browser allows you to make your own server as well as choose from modded vanilla and custom build servers. Custom servers let you train and get a feel for what most of Rust is like. This game has its wins and losses. Don't make any stupid moves that you think is logical but could cost you hours of farming. Treat everything with care and make sure you design your base well so it has a better chance against raiders. Location of your base is key if you want to succeed. On the flip side if you're the one raiding make sure you know what you're doing. Explosives are valuable and rare in this game so wasting them will cost you. Make sure your friends are trained to play this game. Watch your back. Have fun playing solo. Community Whoa.I would divide the community of Rust into 5 sections The nice people the zergs the tryhards the toxic and the suspicious cheaters. Everybody except the nice people have a fair amount of toxicity. 10% tryhards 25% cheaters 35% toxic 20% zergs 10% nice people overall. The cheaters will always dismiss that they're cheating and will rain toxic comments down upon you to make them look better. Before I forget There is an overwhelming amount of younger kids on here. They're annoying cocky as hell and get super toxic when you have the upper hand.Early Access That's about it it's in EA. Only problems with this is bugs can be found optimization could be improved and there is a chance of future updates that could ruin the game. That being said about EA let's move on to the PRICE.PRICE It's not worth $35 IMO. If it were a full game with a little bit more content sure. I'd say right now it's worth $20 $25. Wait for it to be on sale. Sure it's fun and it has its moments but this game has been out for 5+ years. TL DR This game is often toxic full of cheaters and little kids but the graphics are pretty nice and gameplay is always diverse giving you hours of endless play. Super fun to play with groups that know what they're doing. The occasional disoriented player in your group is fun too. Just don't let them go out with a full metal kit and an AK.7.5/10.

review: I used to play this game back in legacy. I loved it then. Now it is a completely different story and nothing but a waste of time in the end. Unfortunately that's how it will always be.This game is a breeding ground for the worst types of behaviors that can come out of people and perpetuates its own toxicity by actively punishing players who try to play without being rude and rewarding players who are. Because of this the community will always be one of the most poisonous and disgusting things that i've ever seen come out of a game.All the things that make this game great... or should I say once did are now what cripples the game. The combat system is fast paced and gets your adrenaline going the downside is that the combat (a VERY large part of the game) is also completely broken. Hitboxes are about as fine tuned as CS 1.6 guns are sloppy and have no actual feel to their weight or usage. The survival aspect of the game is all but gone. Food and water? Nah not important just pick up the hundreds of scattered mushrooms all over the ground and you're set. This once great survival game now no longer has any survival aspect to it the goal of the game is a rush to gather resources and blueprints build a base raid people and then have the server restart two weeks later so you lose your progress. Imagine playing a campaign game GTA V for exmaple getting to the final moments right before the final heist and your game crashes and corrupts your save and makes it unplayable. That is what the game in turn forces on to everyone.Want to know why servers have to restart every two weeks to a month? It's because the game lacks any sort of balance and in the end it corners server owners to have to restart the game so that it "levels" the playing field. In reality this doesn't fix anything. Once it's wipe day zergs come to the rescue to loot everything build a massive base and then proceed to raid everyone else without any challenge thus making it impossible for anyone that has a group of four or less to survive and actually progress.TL DR Quick List VERY POOR Optimization Broken Combat Unrealistic Weapons Unbalanced Awful Community NOT NP Friendly ZERGS Galore Overly Complicated For What It Is Lack Of Actual ProgressIf any of that sounds fun to you go ahead and "enjoy" the game. As for me i'll go ahead and leave this game uninstalled until the end of time wanting for the days of legacy when the community was good and the game was fun.

review: I feel as if the game has so much to offer now that I have returned and feel fresh than ever. The game is best played with a team because you can gather resources faster you can farm faster and you can fight others together! Do not get me wrong teams can get defeated if the right player is on the other side of the battlefield. If you are going to be the only one playing you are going to have an issue with the word Zerg (basically a group of people) The game requires strategic playing and awareness very primal survival adds another layer of showing that even if you have just started you can defeat a geared player. You might not like the game at first but a few hours in and you will get the feel that's how everything works. The game is also built off of servers meaning there are servers that are easier than others (loot wise) To wrap this up I have a few more player to player advice The game is a grind you need to play a minimum 5 hours a day to ensure up keep on your base as well as getting weapons PVP and getting loot. Do not rage quit even if you have been farming for 30+ minutes and you get killed it happens to everyone (it's part of the game) you have to be willing to take the risks. To finalize everything I said Great game to kill time kill off people and actually feel amused by taking your hard earned loot and getting better. The game also offers amazing base building where you can store your valuable loot from other players and to craft items. But be careful others can raid it and steal it all!I suggest you watch some youtube videos on the game and see if you like it!

title: Rust

review: After playing rust for over 250 hours I can safely say that this game is not for everbody. It really appeals to a very hardcore audience.Pros Very Engaging while playing Rust it can feel like time flies by if you are having a great time. I have had a lot of nights were I will get on at 8 00 and I will be shocked to check my phone and have it display the time 11 00. Great Pacing If you can "get gud" you can have a base and loot withing a few hours on wipe day and the grind isn't super long and tedious like in other survival games (like Ark). It is all paced so that a small group of maybe 3 5 people can reach end game within 4 days and go raid and have fun for the rest of wipe easy to start Each server in this game has a wipe cycle which means they wipe the server of bases change the map and may clear all learned Blueprints on a regular bases. This makes it really easy to start on wipe day were everybody starts from the ground up and if you don't make very good progress just start again the next week or find a different server that has a different wipe schedule.Cons Toxicity is a huge problem Players in Rust will gladly kill you on sight whenever they see you even if you have nothing. Hell when you spawn on the beach with nothing but a rock and a torch you may be suprised to see another naked trying to kill you just to get your rock. I don't know why people even do this maybe they don't like the way there rock is looking at them so they want yours or they just think "HAHAHAHA I just killed this other naked with a rock EVERYBODY LOOK AT ME IM A GOD." Whatever the reason people do it so be prepared. Zergs a Zerg is a huge clan with at least 10 or 13 consistent members that are consistently online. These groups can be really fun to play in and I myself have met some awesome people by joining these clans but going against them is going to make your life a living hell. If you are on an official server solo you are pretty much screwed. You will constantly be mowed down by these groups who accumulate gear like a hoarder accumulates trash. Playing alone is super hard Playing solo is like playing Rust on Ultra Mega Hardcore even for experienced players. If you don't have friends that play rust or can team up with you expect a lot of frustration. The Skill Gap Calling the skill gap between new players and experienced players a "gap" is like calling the ocean a puddle. This usually isn't a problem in games because usually experienced players play against experienced players but this is not at all the case in rust. Everybody is thrown onto the same servers which means that you are going to consistently encounter players with 500 1000 2000 or even 5000 hours in the game. They may be nice to you but many out of fear or their twisted ways will try to kill you the moment they see your ugly mug. And often they will succeed in their efforts of turning your skull into another trophy.AdviceBeing a new player can be extremely hard so here are some things that helped me when I first started out Try to get your friends to buy the game If you can get just a few people to buy the game with you then you will have 10x more fun. Even though you may still die and lose progress it will be way less painful if you have some people to support you. Play on a modded server Even though I personally think vanilla Rust is the best way to experience the game playing on a 2x 3x or even 4x server can help you learn the mechanics of the game at an increased rate and with much less punishment for failure. Play on a server that restricts player group size If you are playing solo or with a group up to three playing on a server that only allows for solo duos and trios can eliminate the threat of zergs which is one of the biggest challenges a person can face. ConclusionRust is honestly one of my all time favorite games because of its challenge and mechanics. It can be really fun to try and compete against other players but expect to get your handed to you on a silver platter until you can learn the games mechanics and get semi decent at PvP. All in All I would give rust at least a 8/10 because this game when it comes down to it is a beautifully crafted survival game that is usually spoiled for new players by its community but if you can get past that early frustration you may find yourself loving this game.

review: This games difficulty slider is the number of people you play with. Play with a 10 man zerg and it's super easy. Play solo is ultra hard permadeath I hate my life mode. As soon as you understand this lesson you will start to appreciate the game. If you don't you end up like that poor guy from Gamespot and hate it. This game is not beginner friendly but if you master it it becomes the best game you've ever played.Everything you acquire in this game can be taken away. You die people can steal your stuff your base can be raided for all your posessions and after a few weeks the server wipes and everyone looses everything. The joy you get from this game is not permanent achievements a high experience level or constant shooting like other games. It's overcoming difficult situations outwitting and outplaying others. That rush you get when you acquire a powerful piece of equipment and make it home alive is unique and you can't get it in any other game. Just beware the rage when you loose everything is emotionally tilting as well so be prepared ).

review: I've played this game for 660 hours and as much as it pains me to give a negative review on a game I loved for so long I feel that I have to. This game was VERY good at points. But now it is just people who KOS clans or zergs of people (big groups of people). I still play this game on a regular basis but I can't say I enjoy it. Rust is just a big grind to build a decent base and as an almost solo player (I have a partner who sometimes gets on) it is hard. I get raided atleast once every wipe from a big clan or when I'm offline. It is impossible to defend your base while your offline. I know raiding is one of the key elements of Rust but when a group of 12 people come to raid me there isn't much I can do. Which brings me on to my next point clans. Clans/zergs are a HUGE problem in this game. I can't count how many times I've been roaming and getting destroyed by a huge group of people. FPS is a one of my biggest problems in this game. I have a decent PC GPU 750ti CPU i5 4460 RAM 8gb Ripjaw. It runs most games no problems. I am aware this game is in early access but come on its been 3 years now. I average about 45 FPS with discord and steam only open. That's not including the the ever so often drops to 1 2 FPS I get about every 5 minutes which last a good 10 seconds. I have died so many times from this. I would only reccomend this game if 1. You have friends to play with 2. If you have a decent PC 3. If you know someone with backround knowledge on the game (It is hard to get a grasp on the game by yourself) That is the end of my review but in my situation I can not reccomend this game.
title: Rust

review: This is a great game depending mostly on pure skill + experience and the situation you are in. Ive always loved waking up on the beach to some random kid screaming while smacking another kid over the head with a rock. The difficulty truly varies between these factors Who you play with What server you play on Your skill and experienceI remember one of my first memories in rust where i didnt know how to make a furnace. Playing a wipe on a server has tought me something new about the game every week ive played. Almost everyone who plays over wipes slowly turns into a cold blooded killer.If you are a new player looking to buy this game or who just recently purchased it watch youtube tutorials teaching you how to start off. You can also learn from a friend who is willing to teach you. Ive tought many friends how to play since they first got the game and its more like a job than a game. All you have to do is listen to your more experienced friends and you will learn fast. There are also many servers that are meant for practice which helped me alot.I recommend this game to dedicated people.
title: Rust

review: No recommendation from me until at least 1 minute is reserved for a disconnected players server slot. review: Y'know sometimes you need time to actually understand things.I will be brief the game is good it is a wonderful survival game probably the best out there.The building mechanics the looting and the procedual worlds are indeed something that no other survival game has achieved.But then you get to the bad part the community.Well all games have a bad side of their communities right? I mean look at League Fortnite and all that stuff.the thing is you're playing a surival game and if you're playing alone oh dear i'm really sad for you.You will die and die and die and die and die. there is no limits. No matter if you're carrying a damn rock completely naked hitting a three YOU WILL GET SHOT IN SIGHT IF NOT BY ONE BUT BY GROUPS OF 3 4 5 OR EVEN KOREAN ZERGS OF 10.They have no use for you or your wood or your stone they WILL just kill you for fun.But hey isn't that the premise of the game? Its a pvp survival game right?It is! But the game lacks PVE aspects things that should make people get together a kind of equilibrium to make people decided if they want to cooperate or not and if they don't they would just have a hard time. Armed groups will roam the whole map with Ak's and stuff killing everyone in sight big clans will take over big part of the map and if they know where you live YOU'RE GOING DOWN.I will say it here if you're playing alone you need to be a God a literal GOD. Because you will be bombarded HARD and you WILL crumble. The game wasn't like this before today Rust is just a Zerg simulator. Not that friendship is bad or that overwhelming numbers are wrong as they are all friends they are just playing the game. But be prepared to suffer get frustrated die and lose all of your time in a matter of seconds. The game really needs some kind of punishment or "balance" for solo players this is just looking like Fallout 76 "Its fun with friends."A game shouldn't have to be like that to be playable this is wrong and the game will eventually die.

review: I've tried quite a few survival games as I love the idea but never really gotten into any of them. Then for some reason I found myself watching Rust videos and having got a key in a Humble Bundle a while before though I might as well give it a go. Seem to be pretty hooked so far. Base building and crafting is well implemented hunting/running away from animals is both fun and slightly scary human NPCs are definitely best avoided early on but the real danger comes from your fellow players! Mostly avoided any confrontations so far but have woken up dead a few times.
title: Rust

review: There isn't a reason on Earth not to buy this game. Exhilirating gun fights an in depth looting system and screaming into your microphone this game has something for everyone. With developers constantly adding new features every month and a community that isn't only stable but thriving you can be sure this will not be a regretable decision. I have so many fond memories of playing with friends on this game. Some of my best friends to this day I met on Rust. This game has countless possibilites endless fun and will live longer than an anti vaccination parent's kid. I definitely reccomend this game to everyone. There is some nudity but that can be censored in the settings menu. Pretty much the only good multiplayer survival game on Steam right now. Enjoy!

review: I don't know where to start with this game. There are many things that make it so unique and fun but there are a few that get frustrating. Before I start with pros and cons don't buy this game if you don't have a lot of time. This game is extremely time consuming. There are so many things that you'll need to grind for. Your going to end up getting raided and having to grind back everything you had before. This game is not for people who give up easily either. You are going to get killed over and over again by someone who's better that you or just has better gear than you do. It's inevitable. But you have to keep going if you want to have fun. Just hit that respawn button over and over again until you are able to get a start. There's also something called a zerg. They are basically a group of 10+ people who kill anything that moves and are nearly impossible to beat because of their sheer numbers. A good thing about this game is the graphics. They are absolutly beautiful if you can run them. It not opitmized very well but it has gotten better. I'd recommend this game to anyone who is looking for a rewarding and fun open world FPS that doesn't mind doing some farming.
title: Rust

review: The 2 Beautiful Cycles of Rust!!1. Good Great Wipe Day Progress Get Satchels + Beancan Deal With Ridiculously Long Crafting Times Die A Couple Times Kill A Couple People Deal With Ridiculously Long Crafting Times Raid The People Around You Save Up For Bigger Raids Make A Compound Deal With Ridiculously Long Crafting Times10% Last Whole Wipe vs. 90% Offline Raided2. Bad Little To No Wipe Day Progress Can't Find The Satchel + Beancan For Your Life Get Some Bad Teir 1 Guns Deal With Ridiculously Long Crafting Times Die A Lot Of Times Kill A Few Nakeds Deal With Ridiculously Long Crafting Times Get Your Empty Base Raided Finally Find Beancan + Satchel Make A 2x2 Deal With Ridiculously Long Crafting Times Kill A Semi Geared Guy With A DB... Die Running Back Home100% Get Off Until Next WipeBoth Scenarios are still an amazing experience!! Although it is known for it's toxic community I think it actually adds to the environment of the game and sets it apart from the rest! HELK is doing an amazing job on the monthly updates bringing in more and more content every time! 10/10 This Should Be A Buy For Every Survival Game Enthusiast!!($35 Is A Bit Pricey!! Wait For A Sale And You Can Grab It For $17 or Less)
title: Rust

Then learn their loot in your research table to ue it against them. Soon enough you can control an island. review: First off. I want to make clear this is MY opinion of why i do not recommend to new players.I love rust don t get me wrong with nearly 1k hours over a few accounts.At the current state of rust would not recommend rust because of the simple reason of Zergs and weapon balance. With the AK having learnable recoil you come across people using recoil scripts on the regular. The M249 being uncraftable you would think its balanced right?? Wrong with it dealing 65 damage so you can mow down anything under a Coffee can and having learnable recoil... A hackers wet dream. The bolt is beyond rare and is only used by Zergs having a base the size of a small castle. The MP5 is also terrible and are underpowered and tends to be out DPS'd by AK's or a SAR. Now to Performance My specs are Cpu i7 4790K OC 4.6GHz (H80i)Gpu EVGA 980ti Hybrid SC x2 Ram Corsair Vengeance 16GB With my specs this game runs like A S S with potato mode and gibs turned to the lowest i get around 30 70 depending on the server. Now this problem isnt strictly Rust s fault its more of the servers you decide to play on. Modded servers are the worse with multiplied gathering there are more bases and structures hence the lower fps.In conclusion if you don t have a group of friends to play with and don t mind the current meta and balancing get Rust it s one of the most enjoyable and well developed Survival game out there with regular monthly updates there is always new content to comeback too. But Rust will always be riddled with Zergs specially in Offical.LAPD For lyfe

review: Worth the buy if you like to respawn a lot lose everything you spent hours worth to farm for or if you're sadistic and like doing the taking. There are a multitood of classes to pick from in this game The Bot Terrible at building Terrible at farming can't aim the gun for his life and never gets 20 feet away from the baseThe Farming Bot Not too bad at the game but relies on clan mates for protection but can farm materials quicker than you canThe Builder Can build a hecka beefy base design that's either good at defending while online or is terrible for defending online but good at confusing offliners.The PvPr Mostly older people who only play rust in their spare time and doesn't need clan mates but could use them to distract other people. The Zerg This is a mutiple people class and (usually) are really bad at the game or extremely good. Raids occur day one.The Chad An all around Rust player can lazer beam you at 200m with an AK roams with Incendinary Rounds and mutiple clan mates that either have m249s ir l 96s + aks.The Sweaters These people try hard at everything they do usually raid the second or third day with tons of rockets. Will yell at you if you mess up.The Joker Typically a solo player doesn't take wipes super seriously will play for real on some occasions these are usually really good players that can make plays or really bad players that act this way to hide their lack of skill.The Roof Camper Perhaps an annoying asset to the game espically in a fight but shoot at you from the comfort of their base to prevent their items from being lost. They claim they can shoot from anywhere in the game.Pick it or not this game will eat all of your time if you let it.

review: You never win you just do a little better each timeThis game made me ragequit several times. You spawn get killed. Respawn and maybe craft something. Get killed. You finally get a grasp of what you can craft and build and you'll get killed building your first base. You're smart so you're gonna farm rescources and then immideiatly build a fortified base. You get killed farming. This game is all about having your short life exterminated as unexpected and inconvenient as possible. You get killed just for the fun of it. You might be swimming in water and your foe has no possible way of getting to your loot they'll still shoot you on sight just for sh*ts and giggles. Watch a lot of youtube in advance so you enter the game with some knowledge of how to play. Don't trust anyone. Build a lot of bases because they will get raided when you're offline. The bigger the base the sooner the raid so stay small. I recommend this game but beware In order to not be the bottom feeder you'll have to grind 12 hours a day!

review: One of the best games i've played in my life this game keeps your busy for days on end. With the gradual progression system in the form of blueprints there's always something to work for and one of my favourite things about rust are the monthly wipes. It's like a monthly christmas where I get to hop on my favourite game with a few of my friends and feel like i've just bought the game.This game also teaches you to be untrusting and relentless since most of the time you have days worth of grinding to be lost within an instant and anyone can take that away from you.All in all a really intense survival game with some fun pve elements. Would recommend 9/10
title: Rust

review: I've been playing Rust since the legacy days and I have a love hate relationship with it. On the one hand You don't get the hardcore survival experience anywhere else. Everything is always on the line confrontation is always just around the corner the game doesn't like to help you and everyone is out to kill you. It has an awesome atmosphere and combat really makes you feel alive You don't respawn close to your killer you don't respawn with any loot. In every gunfight your entire inventory is on the line. Which really helps with ramping up your stress levels. Don't play this game if you hate losing. Because you will lose. Often.But that also makes winning more satisfying. Winning big gunfights and demolishing an entire enemy base is very satisfying and can feel amazingly rewarding. On to the cons Mining and gathering resources can be a chore and sometimes you just want to get some loot up without getting shot by some dude with an AK. Getting raided can be incredibly Also the game has a bad code. The content's awesome but at even the highest framerates the game feels choppy. It's because of bad code they haven't replaced for years. The lighting system is so good and so bad at the same time.... At night campfires look absolutely amazing. Natural lighting or electrical lighting at night looks so god damn good. But without light it's borderline impossible to see anything and the lighting during sunrise/sunset looks very ugly. They changed the lighting system to stop people abusing the "increase gamma" exploit which would allow players to up their gamma to be able to see more at night Which is understandable! It's literally impossible to see anything at night especially if you're above someone. Every shape or landscape just turns black. It's quite annoying considering midnight gunfights and raids seem like the most awesome thing ever but in realism they're extremely difficult cause you can't even see what you're shooting.Anyhow this is why I love and hate the game. I'll continue to play it on and off probably until it dies it holds a special place in my heart. Would certainly recommend trying if it appeals to you.
title: Rust

review: I used to play this game a lot. That was until they ruined it. The current progression system is ridiculously unbalanced compared to previous ones and the devs don't even acknowledge it and keep adding irrelevant stuff to the game. I'd even prefer the XP system over the current one. At least back then no one had AKs on the 1st day of wipe.Another thing that the devs managed to ruin was the gunplay. It used to be nice and balanced quite skill based where someone skilled enough could take on someone with better gear due to their superior skill. These days this rarely happens because the easier to get move primitive weapons have been nerfed to the grave. Crossbow headshots that used to be able to oneshot a player with a metal facemask if hit in the correct spot now struggle to do 40 damage. The team UI update was another nail on the coffin and has sealed the deal for me.Without significant changes to the progression system I most likely will never play this game again and can't recommend that anyone else should either. It's simply too unbalanced and unfun in its current state. It's a shame really considering how great the game once used to be and how much potential it used to have.3/10

review: 2014 10/10Rust is the best survival game I've ever played. I've already played Infestation Day Z SA for some hours. But I can assure that the experience of this game is the best of all. I can say also that Infestation is garbage and Day Z SA needs lots of improvements. I've watched Nether and I didn't like the gameplays of that game but nether has other logic(and as I said I didn't like it).So in my opinion RUST is the best optionGood Simple and complex system of crafting. Beautiful graphics. No lags. There are not many bugs Very good gaming experience. Hardcore SurvivalBad Some minor fixes should be made. Some things should be added to this game(like the option to destroy our buildings).2018 The game is awesome and keeps getting updates however it takes a lot of time to load even if you have an SSD. Also I get framedrops even with good pc specs and with settings lowered.

review: The game itself is fun and the server admins I've interacted with have been really nice. I personally loved grinding for materials and building up bases with my friends. Building and gathering is what got me hooked on Rust but other random players is ultimately what made me stop playing. Even on "noob friendly" servers I was getting raided almost daily and if I didn't log on for a day or two my base would have a wall or doors blown out and all my hard work would go to waste. On normal servers people immediately kill on sight even if you're naked with no supplies. People will also camp bases and make it their mission to murder you as many times as possible and take all your stuff even if it's just a rock. One time my friend was wrongly accused of raiding someone's small starter house and they mercilessly killed her and then me as well. Other players' toxicity and general want to kill everyone in sight really put me off. Overall Rust is fun but just be ready to have your heart and soul absolutely crushed when some bloodthirsty vindictive monster comes along and takes and destroys everything you worked days for. Don't get attached to any of your items or buildings.

review: The curve of this game is so steep that in order for you to have an understanding of what you're getting into when you start playing you need to either experience constant failures or have an experienced player who is willing to teach you thousands of things.This game could be good but it is definitely not good. After a 10 minut eloading screen with no sense of when you're about to actually load in lag often occurs every time anything serious happens making even the hardware curve way too steep for an enjoyable experience.Just yesterday my game forcibly closed 10 15 times in about a 4 hour window of time. Sometimes the game would freeze while I am simply replying to another player in the in game chat other times it freezes when I have 1000 scrap on me and im crossing a very exposed river causing me to get raided due to disconnect.My video settings are on potato and I have everything turned off (EVERYTHING) and have everything turned to to 50% that can be. The only thing I didn't change was the draw distance because I assume (the game doesn't tell you of course) that that would affect how far I see other players which I left alone.With potato quality and everything on the lowest settings possible I can't understand why my game closes so often that I now expect it to close 2 3 times per hour of actual game play.Seriously beyond the toxicity and near impossible defense against zergs and random trolls that are literally destroying your game this game simply doesn't hold up like any other game like it.I have never seen graphics become such an issue.What a shame I wasted my money and time playing this game. This game should go back in development until you stop seeing 20 recent complaints per day about how this game doesn't play on peoples' computers short of a beefed up Alienware.UPDATE DEC. 7 2018 Decided to get back into Rust because after a reinstall it was working better.Played for 6 hours until I got disconnected due ot the Dec. 7 update. After restarting my PC the game no longer works. I can't load into a server. I have tried 3 modded servers 2 official servers and even the Intoxicated battleground one. NONE will let me load in. The game freezes before I can wake up.How did the game go from being to not being able to load at all? Seriously they got my money. And this is what I get? You ruin the game I paid for months after the fact? How is that even legal? I was literally just playing it before you forceably updated it to a non working condition. t and no refund is to be expected. They can just ruin the game and make it unopenable.I contacted support for help about this and they sent only one email one day later saying to verify the game files. That's all they told me. So of course I had already done that and re installed Rust and reinstalled Steam nothing. Sent them 3 update emails to my ticket and it has been 5 days now no reply.I guess Facepunch just chooses when they feel like helping certain owners of Rust and when they decide some you should just sit at home wishing you could play your game but cant. Is this part of the games' challenging meta?Unacceptable.

review: Now a few sweat nerds may say i don't have an opinion cuz I don't have 30 000 hours on the game and im no zuckles or hjune. But then that would pretty much mean half the people who play this game don't have an opinion which is kind of sh!t. Some of the best pvp i've ever experienced in a game due to its fast pace and now all I do is play combat tags. But I think everyone can agree that some kind of nerf needs to happen on zergs and clans I even have a few ideas one what to do about the problem like 1. Upkeep depened on how many sleeping bags are in that base and the size of the base This will force zergs to have more than one base and reward people who do not play in outrageous numbers I think if there are more than 3 5 bags in a base the upkeep should increase.2. Make the green dots above teamates invisible until you hover your mouse over them for 2 seconds This will reward good zergs for comunication and will punnish the unorganized zergs with the two seconds Thoose are the only two I can think of right now but comment some more suggestions below Anouther thing that needs to happen is that scrap costs should be lowered. The reason why they're so high is to stop big clans from getting everything day one and to have a sense of progression but since their so high all it's doing is encourging claning and punish small groups of 2 or 3 for not having 8 people grinding for scrap and lets be honest clans are still going to get everything on day 1 or 2 so you might as well just help the smaller groups and lowering it just by a little (like the revolver to 50 scrap semi rifle to 200 or 175 and the Assault rifle down to 650 or 550 scrap) Then optimization should be a bit better (and no my pc isn't . My pc has the reccomended specs on the store page but still gets lag on official servers like rustafied long two weeks into wipe. But after that I think rust is a really good game and most of the problems are somewhat easy to fix I think. If you are planning on purchasing this game do it on a good sale (40% off).

I would constantly freeze and have stutters. I had to make some external changes and still only had max 30FPS. Honestly the game is super fun however I reccomend only if you have a high end computer until facepunch fixes some of the optomization issues.

Assume its nothing.Continue upgrading house but dont go outside.Go outside to visit friendly townsfolk up the hill and trade.Open door.Bang. Dead.Respawn in home Bang. Dead.Respawn in town. review: First of all Rusts community is possibly the worst community you have ever seen in any game. Even regarding that it is a PvP survival game. There is like not a single friendly player which i don't expect to be honest but would be a nice thing to see. I think people are confused and think that Rust is a Battle Royale you'll often see fresh spawns killing each other for literally the sake of the kill and nothing else.Nevertheless Rust is a well made game. The community surely isn't the fault of the developer and i like the quiet times in the game when you're just farming with you friend as well as the casual reasonable fights between me and another player. Rust would be a seriously nice game to play if it wasn't for this community.I think Rust doesn't deserve a thumbs down for the community because it really is a good game. Thumbs up to the developers but thumbs down to everyone who has this game. And yes even thumbs down to myself and my friends. The toxicity is infectious and since everyone is doing it we also started to kill every single living being on a server. In the end buy it or do not. Just keep in the community in mind. It's not that there is this one player on the server who always trolls you the whole server trolls itself.Final rating 7 out of 10

review: А теперь разберём по полочкам стоит ли вам покупать данную пародию на DayZ или нет?ПлюсыРазработчики поддерживают связь с игроками. Есть немного атмосферы Хорошая графика(может быть минусом) Интересно играть МинусыСкины Обновления стали 1 раз в месяц вместо одного раза в неделю. Хорошая графика (нужен мощный комп когда на серваке слишком много домов и они гниют.) Есть читерыВыживает тот кто раньше зайдёт и набьёт ресов.(тк как Топ лутеры мешают кепкам выживать)Можно играть только после фулл вайпа с рецептами.(Сразу Топ лут зарейдят)На модифицированных серверах есть донатеры. Цена теперь вместо 419 рублей 619 рубНету Rust LegacyЧто же это такое Rust LegacyЭто совсем другой раст который зародился в 2013 году как браузерная игра.Вскоре появившись в стиме набрала популярность.Это игра где я прочувствовал атмосферу постапокалипсиса и нашёл друзей.Rust Legacy 9.5/10Rust Experimental 7.5/10New Rust 6/10 Вывод Играть можно если вы не играли в подобные игры.

review: Honestly the best PvP survival game on the market currently. It's PURE PvP and survival and nothing else. You start with nothing and try to get the best gear you can by whatever means possible.This game will make you feel every single emotion except love. There is no love or trust in Rust. There is anger surpise happiness boredom anticipation fear etc. And you can experience all of this within mere minutes. You're going to build up a sweet base in a great location and get your chests full of good items then you're going to lose it all and you have to be okay with that or else you're going to hate this game. You're going to have to start over and over again and everytime you get more anxious. But when you finally get in a position to pull of a sweet play and kill someone with loot it's a wonderful feeling and you'll want more and more of it. You can't be scared in this game or else you'll have a bad time. You have to walk around with your in your hand and a spear in the other ready to ruin someone elses day. The memorys you'll make on this game will be some of the best when it comes to video games this game feels raw as hell in the best way possible.

review: Have you ever wanted to experience disappointment after disappointment? Have you ever wanted to play for a day then wake up the next morning to find all your progress gone so you can do the same thing over again only to loose it all again? Have you ever wanted to meet toxic people? If you answered yes to any of those questions rust might just be the game for you. Yes at times rust can be fun and occasionally you may meet someone who seems to not be totaly toxic they may be a nice person but more times than not prepare to get killed on sight or offline raided by your new "friends"People will offer to help new players and give them free stuff now by all means accept the help take the free stuff but don't put no trust in strangers and never bring someone to your base no matter how helpful they are they will raid you the moment you log off or go afk. Rust can be less of a survival game and more of a home invasion simulator at times.

review: Rust..It's the simple uncouth joy of doing bad things to other human beings but Rust has a distinctly regressive effect on the human species. The voice chat merges with the draw distance so when you're spotted by an idiot you'll start hearing the talk quietly tickling your ear. They get closer they get louder and more confident and suddenly you're hopping over shotgun blasts while absorbing an entire dictionary of insults. The auditory experience is both fantastic and haunting. They have made changes to make it somewhat not so stale from the birth of the game. It is both frustrating and rewarding. Rick reward is very much alive in this game. Either you love it or hate it.

review: TL DR Don't buy it it's a toxic pile of trash that's a marathon of death upon mild success.Rust is a huge crock of trash. Unless you have a dedicated server a dead server or sheer luck Rust will not be a fun experience for you. You will be killed on sight by anyone no one is willing to help you 99% of the players are toxic as hell and the gameplay bone dry. Besides the giant performance issues the Unity engine brings forth and also the downright unusable mess of the chat system there's little joy in running for your life for 15 minutes trying to gather the minimum supplies to create a pickaxe or hatches. By the time your naked body is covered in maybe some gloves or something for your feet you'll be dead. Or at the very least starving. Or being shot at... Or being set ablaze... Lets not forget that if you're a beginner with no idea what to do you'll be given no help by fellow players and they'll just taunt you with such things as "I love killing nakeds" and "If I see you I'll kill you for 1 scrap". This game is a huge pile of trash a game somehow even worse than the DayZ standalone or even terrible Steam Greenlight survival games.

review: My friends and I begin a raid plan.We construct a raid tower to overlook a guy's base.Two people overwatch.Three to try to parkour inside the base.I am the only one that gets into the wall.Friends die trying to get in.They're forced to abandon me.Find a safe isolated corner.I jump into it.Find out it is impossible to get out once you're in there.Call for help screaming on mic to the defenders to get me out.I bang on the walls with my bone clubs.They send naked men with machetes to take me down.I kill one of them with my trusty waterpipe shotgun.Out of ammo take machete.Continue to kill 3 more nakeds with the machete.One of the defenders become disarmed and wounded.I help him up.We're both stuck in slave pit.I compliment his body features (especially the lower body)We become buddies.Ends up glitching up the wall and boosting him up to allow him to leave.I hear a fall followed by screams he dies from wooden spike traps.Rust in Peace Vengeance."BIG DADDY DAN" comes along and gives me food clothes and resources through a tiny crack in the pit.We become best buddies.He dies to an AK from the defenders.Rust in Peace Daniel.Spend an hour sitting there playing the guitar.Friend comes along to boost me out.True "Saving Private Ryan" moment.Run free to the north like a black slave in the 1800's.10/10 game would tell my tale of escaping slavery to grandchildren.TL DR Went raiding got stuck inside base forced to kill to survive made buddies that died boosted out to tell tale.

review: TBH writing a review for the STEAM AWARDS BADGE but the game is truly good.Gameplay is awesome.You get good ant somewhat realistic feeling PVP gunplay there's also base building farming ant etc. but mostly your gonna be fighting. The other elements revolve around fighting in some way so don t expect much besides PVP and raiding/getting raided.Community.There are some hackers but they ussualy get banned pretty quick.Community as a whole is mostly toxic but that's to be expected from a PVP game don't you think?THE DEVSDevs are active. A roadmap montly updates if needed quick patches. Lot's of devs from survival games lack that these days. But in rust FACEPUNCH is very active and they don't look like they are planning to abandon rust in any time soon. They fixed most of the issues from legacy alpha beta and every month add something new to keep the game alive.So if Fallout 76 left you dissapointed give this game a try.

review: This game is everything I expected it to be. Challenging exciting frustrating fun and strategic all rolled into one. I joined and started playing this game a few days on the Rustopia US Main after it did its weekly wipe. Don't expect to progress very far since most of the player base is established already with prime locations and etc. Also be prepared to die...A LOT. There is a lot of grieving and toxicity so if you get your feelings hurt easy then this isn't the game for you and you should move on to something less...evil. The one thing I did see is immediate bans for homophobic and racist comments...that alone is a huge improvement. I applaud that. They receive bad marks for allowing anyone under 18 in the game though. There are many underage members. The graphics and sound is very nice. For being a DayZ clone these guys did a bang up outstanding job. The only thing that I would probably be critical of is not letting new players understand what exactly they are getting into. It would also be nice for them to open up a newbie server that focuses more on game mechanics and understanding them versus just going around and cannibalizing everything and everyone for the LULZ.I hope this is helpful. I'm a friendly in game if you see me feel free to join my little community. )

review: I wrote a review back in 2017 on my main account. But now I've got a broader understanding of this game and I've played offical for enough now. So here is my 2018 review on rust.The game is super fun even after having nothing and starting over again with a rock in hand. But it's as toxic as it's ever been. And not gonna lie i'm really toxic as well. But I think one of the biggest problems in this game with offical servers. Is asians and hackers. Asians don't have any servers so you have them come to the Australian servers so it's really hard to communicate. And hackers are everywhere there flying around instant doming people raiding people exactly where there loot is. It's really annoying. Edit 23/12/2018I was playing on Facepunch 2 Official back in the day which was filled with Asians. I've moved on and there isn't that much once you move other offiicial servers There are still asians but not alot. Don't have a problem but it's a lot of Asians are hacking/hard to communicate with or in big zergs which makes the game a bit unfun at certian times. but if you can get past that your good. The optimization is terrible in this game and I have to play on Potato graphics with a 1050ti and a i7 to keep my frames during PvP Also has anyone noticed the decrease in frames and good animations over the years? Just a quick thing to point up But at this current state of the game I give rust a 8/10.I'm going to rewrite this review at a later date. please leave any constructive ideas in the comments that I could address in my next review.

review: THIS GAME IS AMAZING. HORRIFICALLY toxic playerbase at times. Good players are gems that glow in the dark and become friends. TONS of stuff to do. You will die a lot at first but if you avoid the starting areas and congested areas you'll have a much calmer funnier time. Build up your bases tech tree Unlock new techs through research and discovered blueprints. Survive attacks on both you and your base. Explore ruins and find chests. Go scuba diving and explore sunken ships. Avoid military base tanks Fly in a balloon with fuel you crafted. Drive a boatsCons See more racial slurs than you've ever seen outside four chan. (four chan is a censored word in Steam? LMAO)Basically if you can be an adult and ignore all the toxicness and avoid congested areas you can put TONS of hours into this game and have a lot of fun. Having friends to play would be a great advantage but I've been doing solo and I've hit 32 hours in like... 4 days. I can't stop binging on this game.TIP There ARE toxic people here. This game is a "Sociopath Simulator." Everyone is cruel. BUT if you CHOOSE to take the highroad other humans WILL find you and you'll make friends. You'd be amazed how much you blow people's minds by simply not killing them and wishing them a nice day. &gt &gt Be the change you want to see in the world&lt &lt

review: rust is a unique survival game were instead of it having balenced pve and pvp it has little pve that impacts you game and makes it a heavy pvp based game that pushes the knowledge and skill of both you and the people around you. Think of it as as minecraft and csgo combined. the reason for saying minecraft as the building aspects are pretty much borrowed but instead of breaking down your base you spent 2hrs on you can simply just upgrade without breaking a simple item with in your fortress. another borrowed aspect of minecraft is the crafting but you have to find the items within a radtown/momument to make more of it and you have differenet tiers of crafting tables which are called workbenches you have a workbench level 1 (which is used to create more basic equipment) the workbench level 2 (which allows more advanced items like sub machine guns or rifes and more advanced base defences like auto turrets) the workbench level 3 (which allows the most advanced armor assult rifes sniper rifes and advanced raiding materials like c4 and rockets). the csgo aspect of rust is of course the guns every gun has a recoil pattern and spread (which can make or break you) an example of recoil (which happens to be the highest recoil in the game) is the ak https //www.youtube.com/watch?v xqXFfFjLlkw this video will so you how the ak recoil looks like other guns are much much simpler than this so if the ak is to much try its counter part the lr 300 but weapons like the lr 300 are uncraftable but can be bought (for scrap this game is not p2w)

Excepts from that I find it to be the best pvp survival game on pc currently there arent many survival aspects in the game but the interesting gun play and hard to master game mechanics make this a game that you will have tons of hours in. Just make sure to play with a fellow gamer or else you will have a tough time!EDIT 5 years after the game got published and 10 months since it left release on feb 2018 There are alot of things In this game that I find to be gamebreaking such as the helicopter shooting nakeds with bows (even when not being agressive). It really shows how much the devs care about the game..

review: At the time of this review I have more hours on Rust than any other game in my Steam library. Suffice it to say that I would not have put in this much time in without giving it a favorable review. That being said a lot has changed in Rust over the years most noticeably the toxic atmosphere created by kids that don't get enough attention from mommy and daddy. This is slowly eating away at the enjoyment of the game. This game is heavily focused on PvP but with the recent introduction of electricity more PvE servers have popped up and it is being compared to Minecraft. minus the blocks and editable terrain.If you like creative games but hate PvP then you will be torn with this game because the creative aspect that you can apply to building a base is great. On the other hand if you like PvP *AND* creative games then you will love Rust because not only can you be creative with your builds but you can make your builds functional too and even moreso with the electrical update.If you're new to Rust or about to purchase choose a small community server to learn on before attempting any of the official servers because the official servers are the most toxic and the constant KOS you will face will make it difficult to learn the basics.

review: After 4 years this is a *good game* but it is impossible to recommend. It's frustrating and a lot of times you'll play for hours with no results. Prepare to waste time for real here.This game is the antithesis of fun. This game is an allegory for life and the futulity of action. Much like in life in this game you will make great effort to both not die and prosper only to inevitably die of something most likely out of your hands. Sometimes you get the opportunity to ruin someone's day. Most of the time they'll be ruining yours. No one wins and everything is dust in the wind. We're all doomed to claw at one another like animals.If you can get over yourself and make friends you might have a chance.This game constantly makes progress gets updates and continues to grow. Take that as you will.

review: Great Game!Rust is a great game and although I m new to it I feel like I ve been playing forever and it s always a thrill when you snowball but always sad when you lose everything (especially when people offline) but there are 2 issues I find in the game that make the experience less pleasing 1. One of the newer guns the L96 is really Over Powered And is easy to get (bandit camp) so I think it should get either a nerf or should no longer be sold at bandit camp2. The group system is great for telling who is friendly and who is not easier but it also has friendly fire meaning that a small group can add a new member who then gains their trust and kills them for all their stuffMaybe this is just me being salty over the amount of times these two things have gotten me back to square one maybe others feel the same but I feel that (especially the first one) these issues should be dealt withThanks ArrowBoi

review: Ive played this game alot... all the way back to legacy. Its awesome... adrenaline filled and great with friends. Facepunch studios have put their heart in soul in to the game. This game keeps you thinking about it even when you aren't playing. Everything is about Rust. The only problem is the community. A summarization of the general pop of Rust above 300 hours just want to be MLG PvP gods and will one day be a Youtube/Twitch sensation... Even on small community servers where most are just looking to have good fun/competition in the world of Rust. Naked/low geared players automatically assume when they come into contact with another player that they will kill them. No talking just shoot on sight or a young boy screaming at the top of his lungs possibly doing both.The worst poeple are the ones who commit all of their free time to the this game. They are usually angry sexually frustrated or trying to live the dream of once becoming MLG Rust famous. If you kill these types of players by some chance they will usually make a threat to raid you when you go to bed. You can stay up till 4am but it doesnt matter. They having nothing outside of this game and will most likely have to start again until you or your friends quit till next mid month wipe.I dont think a talk with the community will work... its more of a cancer.Long live the old BP system and Rust 2015 to 2016.P.S. We didnt need the party system.

review: Too many hackers. Official servers have no admins to help the players. The devs ignore these issues. Very fun game with friends but the official servers are awful as far as administration goes. People will be kicked like 5 times in the hour over movement violations and are still allowed to play and possible fly hack into peoples bases.Would not recommend until Facepunch either ups their anti cheat program or provides active and useful administration to their offical servers.Gameplay is clustered and scatter brained as well balance and PvP is a mess. Devs have been trying to find something that sticks after three years. Game optimization ranges between catastrophic and acceptable. Recommended SIXTEEN GB of RAM and the game installed on an SSD.There is so much potential for a great game under all the issues. The devs constantly dream of interesting and fresh ideas but are either left on the white board or are implemented and require months of bug fixing.I do want this game to be good. I only criticize because it could be a stellar game.*** EDIT JANUARY 11 2018 ***Most of my complaints that reduced my recommendation have been resolved. Most servers official and otherwise have effective anti cheat. Game optimization has improved to the point where mid range PCs can play it comfortably. Gameplay loops haven't changed much over the years guns are still overpowered as is offline raiding. However there is a great amount of fun to be had. It is a simple pleasure to harvest resources make and protect a base and screw with random folks on the server. Would recommend. Very good with friends.

review: It may be considered a game in the genres of survival and building (I think its close to 7 Days to Die and such).You start naked only with a stone (which is your first tool to get stone wood etc.) and a torch. Nothing else. With this is you gradually try to get ressources feed yourself defend yourself and make a base. Within this base you can make research and get to better materials (eg. iron using a furnace etc.) and therefore better equipment.There are also NPCs that may make your life harder (depending on where you are on the map).This is not too bad. I have seen better games in that regards but certainly worse. It is rather intuitive and the tutorial rather easy to grasp. The graphics are pretty and on the "comic" side but in my opinion fit pretty well.You can play it solo (haven't tried that though) and with friends (hosting your own server). In my opinion this is the only way to play it. Playing it with friends might be considered fun even though it may take away (some at least) the challanges of PvP.There are community servers (non official server for public access) which may also worth taking a look.Playing on an official server (you need to play there to get the steam achievements) can only be considered toxic. It's pure PvP with no rules and absolutely no noob friendlieness at all (noob meaning here new on the server with no functioning base).It took me over 32 deaths I stopped couting after that all within 3 to 4 minutes to get TWO single achievements (getting scrap from barrels and destroying barrels. Afer each death you start over naked with no materials and somewhere else on the map (not even close).Naked me got attacked by other nakeds and by others fully equipped with automated weapons. All out of nowhere no interaction what's'o'ever. Within these few hours only ONE single player gave me an iron hatchet and left me alone.So ....if you like this kind of challenges....go for it and play on official servers. I can't recommend it. Fortunately there are other options )

review: So Rust over the years in beta suffered alot of setbacks. From deers deciding to scale mountains to run away to people building a massive tower and jumping into your base. However since full release in Feb it has greatly improved and i give the Devs credit. They fixed optimization issues dead spots in the landscape glitching characters gun lagging and everything else. The game runs so much smoother and they added tons of side events which makes you feel like you arent doing the same thing over and over again like in wave games or MM. They also routinely speak to the players about both present and future updates. Even with the price increase i would recommend this game especially to group gamers. This is such a relaxing yet vigorating game and im looking foward to future updates.

review: Rust. If you've ever played minecraft think of it like that except add on alot more murderous players explosives such as rockets and c4 and the occasional helicopter to come shoot you down if your not indoors. dont forget the animals as even a chicken can kill you. Rust is a open world type of game where you gather materials and build a base and then fight off other players to protect this base or you go destroy somebody elses base and take whats rightfully yours. Yes as some reviews say there are negatives. being(1) Hackers are lurking around corners left and right. but most of the time the modded and community servers do a good job of banning these snot nosed kids quickly.(2) As a solo player you will struggle in this game. yes your going to get raided alot. yes your going to get shot down by multiple people ranging from a 2v1 to a 6v1. but it is quite fun to be doing your own thing with nobody else to disturb you.(3) i see some people complaining about faulty admins. yes your correct these admins will most likely be abusive but also if you join a server with "ranks" on it like urusty servers in modded you'll notice the admins actually arent allowed to play the game at all they just watch players for cheating. there are several servers like this and a way to find them quickly is just looking through and seeing if they have ranks or a store or something like that.Overall if i had to rate this game 1 to 10 i would give it a solid 8.5 graphics are nice i like that you can vary the graphics in the launcher depending on your pc the voicechat is very nice to communicate with other players ( toxic or not ) And this game is special. as all servers wipe bringing you a new fresh map with new people daily which is what i personally believe is why so many people play rust and keep coming back to it week after week.

review: I made a review on this game back in april when i went on my run of making reviews for certain games I played. I am rewriting it since a lot has changed in 8 months. First this game is still one of the hardest games for new players on steam but is rewarding when your skill level gets higher and higher. I used to be hot at this game and after 300 hours i know consider myself half decent at aiming. This game is a perfect blend between realistic survival and arcadey survival. The hardest task in this game is 'soloing' or playing by yourself but i have made plenty of steam friends via this game. Overall some of the new additions like the ship and military transport helicopter that were not relavent when i did my first review are great additions. However some like the electronics and traps added very recently seem to be a needless chore like a minecraft mod. This game is fantastic and easily lands a place in the top five of my most favorite steam games of all time and if you can get it for a good price like $25 or so buy it however you will need a beefy computer to run the game fair warning. Rate 9/10 stupid ing nakeds.
