review: Update 01/01/2019 This game is trash and you should avoid it as a solo player or someone who has a small group of friends as you won't stand a chance against the zergs or the hackers. Not recommended.Rust is one of those games which you either love or hate. It depends on whether or not you can blend in with one of the most toxic communities in all of gaming. People seem to misunderstand this for a cooperative survival game. This is NOT for people who are looking to be friendly and live peacefully. This is an intense PVP game thats meant to make you mad.1. A very small portion of the Rust community is friendly. This game seems to turn most of us into complete s2. You will die a lot. 90% of the people will be to you and kill you on sight even if you got nothing.3. You will get salty over losing some good loot that took you a while to collect. This will occur multiple times.4. Someone (Sometimes huge clans) will always raid your base while you're online or while you're sleeping.5. The optimization of this game is simply awful in it's current state. Make sure you play on lowest settings.My suggestions to enjoy Rust 1. FInd a friend to go duo with if you're new. Solo is usually insanely hard for new players (especially on official servers)2. Try out Low pop community servers or High rate modded servers to get a hang of the game.3. Modify and change your mindset to become a complete to everyone else to feed on their salt.4. Git gud. It takes a lot of practice and experience to build a proper base and use weapons effectively.And finally try to learn to let things go. If you die with your best rifle or a crap ton of resources don't get mad. That's what everyone else is looking for to make people rage quit. Just make an effort to farm it back and get some sweet revenge!Coming to my final verdict
title: Rust

review: Great PvP game that is very rewarding to those who have skill or put in effort to improve their skill. It is definitely an unfair game if you do not understand what's going on such as different styles of servers like solo/duo/trio and keeping up to date which days the servers wipe. You will most likely have no fun if you join mid/late week so it's important to learn wipe schedules. Playing solo is very stressful you will die a lot but it is possible to do this alone once you learn how to pvp or avoid confrontation. This game can take a lot of your time up but you can play modded servers that will speed up gameplay so you can have fun over a weekend instead of grinding for a week straight. Highly recommend this game if you love PvP. This game has a lot of negative reviews because I don't think people understand that the main goal is to kill each other and they try playing it as a survival game. Which it is but to survive against your neighbors.

review: I ve played about 200 hours on rust and I can easily say it is the best survival/crafting game I have ever played. I really enjoy the concept of spawning into a desolate wasteland having to deal with animals other players scientists and numerous other things in order to survive. I absolutely love the crafting system and base building system. I have played games that have had similar building mechanics in them but there is just something about the way rust employs these mechanics that really take the cake for me. I enjoy how you can choose numerous different servers to match your play style whether it be intense pvp or limited pvp week wipes or monthly wipes. The choice is yours and it is nice to see a game give you this decision to make. I would full recommend this game to anyone looking for a very enjoyable experience. 10/10
title: Rust

title: Rust

review: I've been playing rust since it came out (legacy). I have to say this is the best game I've ever played. The devs truly love the game and you can see that with their almost weekly updates for half a decade now. The game has come such a long way and is continuously getting better. I play solo which is a huge challenge but part of why I enjoy it so much. This game is not for the weak and will require that you learn A LOT before making huge progress but ultimately it is so rewarding to see your hard work come to fruition. The game also compliments people with various play styles. If you are a creative person that likes to build bases set up traps and strategically get ahead then you can do that. On the other side if you like to PVP and progress through getting other peoples loot that you kill you can do that as well. Rust truly is the closets thing to real life in a game.

review: In All Rust is a good game. There are too many little kids for a full nudity game. its really easy to become or meet a toxic player. Community Not really a community Toxic Somewhat Toxic Normal Friendly Extremely FriendlyThe community is less toxic than csgo but if you play on the right server expect to be offline raided constantly its almost impossible to play for a long time without a crew. The community is also really helpfull at times. if you need help with a certain item there will be some people who will help you find or use that certain item. Audience Kids Everyone Casual players Pro playersRust has imediate nudity the second you load into the game. I would not advice your children 13 (Under) to play this game. There are alot of guns and raiding blowing up things if you are a liberal and you want liberalism to run in your family dont let this game be purchasesd. Graphics Potato Really bad Bad OK Good Beautiful MasterpieceThe graphs are really good. at times it can look super realistic but the building mechanic can really take you out of it. other then that dont expect extra wrinkles on character model. Nothing like FarCry 5 and JC3. Price/quality Free Full price Wait for sale Average Refund it if you can Don't buy itPersonaly i would wait for a sale. the game is too much for a Build&amp Shoot Simulator. but if you have friends who are willing to play with you i would absolutly buy it at full price. MicroTransactions No Microtransactions Some Microtransactions (Not Shoved in your face) Some Microtransactions (Shoved in your face) A lot of Microtransactions (Not Shoved in your face) A lot of Microtransactions (Shoved in your face)MicroTransactions consist of clothing and asestics much like the csgo system. PC Requirments (if you want it to look decent) 90' PC (Laptops running windows Vista with CPU integrated Graphics) Minimum (any AMD Series Not to be rude. ) Medium (Geforce GTX 600 &amp 700 Series) Fast Gaming/Hobiest PC (Geforce Gtx 800 &amp 900 series) High end Gaming/Hobiest PC (1000 Series) NASA computer (2080 TI) Difficulty You just need 2 arms Easy Easy to learn / Hard to master Hard Dark SoulsThe game is mostly easy its not that difficult to get into building and understanding how the crafting system works. Game time/length Really short ( 0 2 hours) Short ( 2 8 hours) Few hours ( 8 12 hours) Long ( 12+ hours) EndlessThe game is a purely multiplayer game for Story No story Still better than Twilight Average Good FantasticThere is lore but there isnt any offical story mode or single player. Bugs Game itself is one big BUG Bugs destroying the game Lot of bugs Few Bugs No Bugs (As far as im aware)There isnt that many bugs as far as im aware but there are a few where dropped items wont appear and stuff. read more on the fourms. DLC No DLC Game needs it to be fun Unneeded Nothing special A fun addition lots of fun Modification Support No Modification Support Steam Workshop Unofficial Modding SystemMuch like csgo you can submit your own items to be added ingame Multi/Single Player Multiplayer Singleplayer What I Recomend A singleplayer mode with an offical story and lore. I am a steam curator. Join my group.

review: I was banned from this game all the way back when only Legacy existed. Now im not hear to make a case or statement outright i blatantly cheated. I did however purchase the game on a different account and have been enjoying it ever since. More now than ever does Rust give a unique feeling when playing. The loot you carry actually has value to you mostly in the form of time and losing or gaining loot is either a huge crash or a pumping surge of adrenaline. Nothing feels better than raiding a base for a case full of weapons and explosives. Rust isnt without its flaws obviously the community is extremely toxic and it can feel disheartening for new players or small groups when a 10 man zerg marches over their base. With this in mind though there are still many positives to the game. Rust has an active dev team that is fully committed to the game and ships monthly updates that can change the landscape of how the game is played and while a good majority of Rust's player base is toxic there are a few individuals who you may make a connection with and then who knows!Side note Thank you to all the devs who have put in the effort to make the game what it is today and thank you for all of your hard work it does not go unappreciated. Much love to daddy Helk keep being a meme!
title: Rust

review: Yes I waited over 1600 hours over the course of four years to write a review.Rust is the best game if you're not faint of heart and enjoy high risk high reward gameplay. Rust does not hold your hand but gives you the tools to pretty much do anything you want. With enough charisma you can create whole communities of strangers set up shops and sell items for the materials you need to maintain your base. If you and your friends are good at PvP you can roam the map and hardly farm anything at all. If you're sneaky (and you'll have to be) you can run solo around the map and into monuments which is some of the riskiest and most thrilling gameplay.You will die a lot. You will get extremely frustrated. Morale will get very low. The eventual big victory is totally worth it whether you successfully defend your base from a raid defeat another group of players in the wild drive another hostile group out of the area or even put up a damn good fight as an underdog in a losing battle.The devs are some of the most active I've seen for a survival game. New content is pushed out regularly and it works as intended most of the time. Whatever small bugs exist are quickly fixed. They also do not compromise on their vision of the game. There are plenty of people (carebears) who have pushed them to make it more forgiving but they haven't budged very much in this regard. They know the game they're making and the niche it fills.Get the game. Git gud. Bring your friends. Make some friends. Take over the map.

review: If you're looking for a game review you've come to the wrong place. But if youre looking for a fantastic pancakes recipe you've come to the right place.MAKES12 thin pancakes (18 20cm each)INGREDIENTS125g plain flour1 egg and 1 yolk300ml milkMETHODSift 125g plain flour into a bowl and make a well in the middle. Whisk together one egg one egg yolk and a little milk taken from the 300ml then pour into the well. Whisk with a little of the flour.Gradually whisk in half of the remaining milk drawing in the rest of the flour a little at a time to make a smooth batter. Stir in the remaining milk. Cover and leave to stand for about 30 minutes.Heat the frying pan and brush with a little oil.Ladle two or three tablespoons of batter into the pan and tilt the pan so that the batter spreads out evenly over the bottom.Cook the pancake over a medium high heat for 45 60 seconds until small holes appear on the surface the underside is lightly browned and the edge has started to curl. Loosen the pancake and turn it over by tossing or flipping it with a palette knife. Cook the other side for about 30 seconds until golden. Slide the pancake out of the pan.Heat and lightly grease the pan again before making the next pancake. Serve the pancakes as they are made or stack them on a plate and reheat before serving. (If the pancakes are hot when you stack them they will not stick together there is no need to interleave them with greaseproof paper.)Total time40 minutes

review: I am writing this review when I passed 920 hours and i am saying that Facepunch has improved their game so much over the past months giving poeple exactly what they wanted ...Error projectile invalid IS FINALLY FIXED !!! As well as giving the rust community more ways to make trap bases by incorporating electricity which is a great addition. Gameplay Pros Solo is hard but is able to be done. Recomended 3 man group. Any group with people 6+ will be set in their wipe in rust.Cons Clans in this game that are 8+ will dominate the server but is able to be tackled by offilining or allying with another group to take down a common enemy.Conclusion This game requires a lot of time to be played since you need to materials to build up your base and aquire new guns aswell as researching them which takes quite a bit of time to do. Being very good in pvp in this game is crucial and you will not get away with not being able to left click on poeple. Consider this game to be a 2nd job working 6 12 pm in a sense that if you dont spend enough time into the game you wont get anywhere. THE GAME IS GREAT !!!!!

review: okay after 2800h played and more to come can i safely say that i ADDORE this game. It is a post apocalyptic survival PvP game that really tests your limits. Spawn on the beach get beaten down by naked people who swing their around to mock you. Esacape the evil circle and make it to the woods start gathering wood and basic supplies like mushrooms and hemp cloth. Craft yourself an hatchet and a pickaxe and start your resource gathering build a shack stash your make a bow and go PvP you're most probably going to die but if you make it congrats your hunt was succesful. Keep stashing your and make a decent base go loot in the closest rad townand find something of value run back to base in hopes of getting there unnoticed and stash your new (better) After many hours doing this you are going to be shocked how time consuming this game is and for what? Wake up next day do whatever you do when you wake up log in on steam eneter rust find your server. to spawn in with the text "you got killed by _ZERG_KOREA_10_MAN_CLAN. now repeat.okay for real this game is amazing however if you have no friends that play this game it is going to be very difficult for you. So keep in mind that soloing in rust is for experienced players if even them. I with 3k hours can have a hard time soloing. One last thing the PVP in this game called Rust is very unnusual please train on some battlfield servers before you actually start playng. hope this review was helpful to the new players and for us experienced ones i hope you agree with me. D

review: I asked for a refund after 3 hours of play time because when i joined a large map my fps was horrible. I shouldn't have to own a half working game. Steam sent bot automated message of refusal twice. I'm pretty sure it was bots anyway. I refuse to believe steams customer service is so bad that they'd refuse someone with one extra hour of play time.Anyway I'm somewhat glad they didn't because once i decided I was stuck with it. I tried to make it better and looked up some video's on how to improve fps in rust and I picked up a few tricks that I didn't know. The biggest of which being the ''Global.free'' command which I believe boosted my fps by about 40 50 and removed most of the stuttering. So now rust is fully playable for me. I guess I'm just making kind of a warning before you purchase make sure you have the specs to run it. Because the que times and the loading screen and the fact you have to change the res outside of the game will most likely put you over the 2 hour limit.REVIEW The first time I spawned into rust ever I was chased by a wolf and there were no platforms to jump on. First death in about 15 seconds of playing the game. That set the curve right away. I laughed. Really hard. If you laughed to this is a game you will enjoy.

review: I do reccommend this game since you will get plenty of play time out of it for the price but there are some things i'd like to add some reasons why i've started playing this game less and less lately. First the good. So the game is definitely worth the price which basically comes from the game's awesome building features and high anxiety combat. At all times in this game you have to be constantly alert and ready to fight because you have to fight for your hard earned loot and resources with other players. It's both good and bad super rewarding to win a fight/raid or completely devastating to lose it all (especially back to back). The other good parts of this game are the updates which are constantly being added with the most recent being electricity and water based updates involving boats and ships. These updates will keep things new and interesting and let you experiment and explore more new locations all the time. However I think there a few fundamental issues with the way the game runs as a whole basically involving balancing. Playing solo is very much possible in this game which is what i've done for nearly all the hours I have in game but it is the most frustrating way to play (on vanilla) since you are always outnumbered always outgunned almost always on the receiving end of a sneak attack/gank or always the target of raids since you can't afford the upkeep for a good base or don't have allies to defend while you're offline. This is essentially what burnt me out on this game restarting every few days or weeks because I was raided by a 2 man 3 man or entire clan. I have tried team play but it feels like a cheap and easy way out and i've always liked a challenging game instead of having everything handed to me. With a group it just feels like you can steamroll anyone in your region and it gets boring once you max out your upkeep and have every blueprint/gun and there isn't much else to do but kill people. It is a fun game overall but it just gets to the point where restarting over and over burns you out. If I come back it might be to try out the new updates but until then i've moved on to more singleplayer oriented survival games like 7 Days to Die or The Forest. I think part of this is my personal preference since I don't really like PVP in general but if you're someone who does and likes a tough skill based game this is for you 100%.

review: I love Rust. I have been playing this game before it was even good. I have so many amazing memories on this game and nothing made me want to stop playing. But the devs. added a new function. The Decay system was added and its actually a really amazing idea it makes idle players bases decay away if they don't get on reducing lag. and it also made players/clans not able to create huge bases because the tax on your base is relative to the size of your base. This is a great idea and system but it doesn't clash well with the other systems in the game. finding blueprints making a base and getting components are WAYYYYY too much to do. This game doesn't feel like a game and it more feels like a JOB. It's actually frustrating because I have to get blueprints for stuff find the stuff to make the stuff I know. and then gather resources for the daily tax on my base. The devs either need to get rid of the decay system (which I don't personally want) or the blueprint system (which I do want). I don't enjoy this game as a solo I would LOVE it if the devs. changed this stuff. But I truly don't think they will and the grind feels like a JOB. Overall I love Rust but can't recommend it because it's just too much and the devs really need to make it feel more like a game and less like a JOB.Please read the big box of text before skipping by my review I have 1400+ hours. I am someone you can believe

review: I love this game. It has very simple mechanics that anyone can jump in and understand. But it is extremely complex in the way you can express yourself. There are endless play styles that you can explore. I tend to be a bit of a pacifist so I try to make friends with my neighbors. If that's not your cup of tea you can go around the map squashing everything you see and take everything for yourself. The players tend to be a bit toxic but if you are not as quick on the draw and willing to give diplomancy a try you can make friendships you never knew could exist before. I definetly recommend giving it a try. And if you are a friendly player like me look me up.

review: Been a longtime lurker on you tube watching the likes of Ser Winter Jordanrants Surge and a bunch of others. Never relaly thought I had it in me to compete PVP but was really drawn to the crafting building side of the game. Purchased the game just before christmas and got into it. Initially had what seemed like lag issues but it all came down to a wireless keyboard. From then on quality gaming has ensured started as a solo a couple official servers. Was getting slaughtered left right and centre some people would pretend "friendly player" then kill you at a short distance (must like the look of my stone tools). Didnt really get any building done just kept getting hammered but Ak's or groups would butcher me. Found a modded server that is local and made a start. Into my second wipe have teammed up with a master builder it seems got the mainbase set on the second day and have just been making mild alterations as we proceed. Really enjoy the duo play have had a few engagements and wow check out the bow if you can hit the headshot Oh what a great feeling. Make sure you internet connection is upto it but enjoying this game have been lucky to get on a good server with top people. Exactly what noob like myself needed. This game is totally value for money +++recommended+++

review: If you are looking into this game with relaxing and joyful gameplay in mind please look elsewhere.BUT!! If you're up for a bit of a challenge and don't mind cocky and immature people this is the game for you! This game offers planning building shooting sneaking raiding and all that fun stuff. It is very unpredictable and offers a variety of servers with different rules and possiblities. Just look around and you'll find something that will suit your taste. Playing alone can be considered to be quite rough to say the least. If you're not a highly skilled player I'd advice you to bring some friends or at least search for some in the server chat or on Reddit.This game is very stressful not to mention frustrating and if you're not careful you may find yourself enraged by one tiny mistake made by either you or your teammates. Many of the players are as mentioned above on the toxic and immature side as this game can bring out the worst in people but if you're thick skinned enough you can take it. Putting this aside I absolutely love this game. It is very fun to play with my friends and I advice you to try it out.I'd rate this game 7/10 (it would be higher if the community wouldn't be so negative).

There is no balance to the game so. Clans are always&gt solo/duos and the only servers that have a group limit are community servers. Gameplay consists of Farming to get loot Pvping to get loot. And PvPing is the fastest way to do this There is a lot of KOS. 90% of the "communityplays the game to kill/raid 9% play to make friends or for fun. 1% hack and make the game 𝑉𝑒𝑟𝑦 fun.Developers keep adding and updating but still havent fixed the t AI or make a single solo/duo/trio official server.There is no story music is walking death esque (turn it off)TL DRThe gameplay good but rage inducing art / music meh community toxic I wouldn't buy this unless you play with friends or in a group

review: Rust. What is there to say about rust that already hasn't been said? Rust is a Survival game set in what seems to be a post nuclear island that is filled with animals scientists and even other players. Players compete (or help eachother) to build up a base farm materials and eventually get great end game weapons before wipe day. Rust is a great game in my book and I love the style look feel and almost everything about the game. It always feels so great to take down The helicopter or get the chinoook crate. The PVP combat system is great giving many different weapons with many different advantages (or disadvantages depending on how you look at it) and giving each encounter to feel unique. To sum up rust is a great game and should be bought and played even for it's somewhat steep price. Love the game and almost everything about it.

review: Look I edited my review before. Most of hours are from Legacy I won't lie I have ever so hated the new direction of this game. Sure albeit that in the begginning it was nice for a change since yeah Legacy looked like a piece of junk but at least it was functional if that. I no longer see a functioning game anymore when I look at this.Yeah the graphics improved but do they run even on my high end system? No.Yeah the map seeds were improved and generate more interesting maps sure but do people refrain from squading up in a clan and camping objectives for components? No. Yeah you could say that the gunplay has improved but is it smooth? Is the bullet drop realistic? Do people no longer roof camp and headpeek like I am playing Counter Strike when my bullets emerge from my characters mouth? No. Yeah they added boats hot air balloons helicopters hell even tanks but can we pilot them? Can we make Soviet Russia the clan we always desired? Can we fuel our engines with Vodka and praise our gracious leader Stalin? No. Can we have tracer battles at night like we are immitating lazer fire in Star Wars? Or is it pitch black and holding any source of light is basically a target for roof campers like I think it is. This game is no longer something I want to be a part of. I have always loved it yes and I come back just about every interesting update to see if they actually fixed FPS optimization and added actual content but despite their convincing fan base that this game has a somehow positive reputation status on reviews despite the price INCREASING for this piece of crap I see no end no improvement the ground mistakes that plagued it at the begginning have not been cured people still run this game on potato whether it be for FPS or for the fact it enables people to be better at PVP I don't know which is worse I feel like I enter Verdun whenever I come back nothing innovative about this game at all. I most definitely recommend to stay away. Despite my hundreds of hours of farming I do not enjoy this game. Period.

Collect some scraps metal ore sulfur ore low grade fuel. Builds a furnace burns down the sulfur and the metal ore upgrades the base to complete stone base. review: This game to me is exactly what early access should be about. For anyone who has played this game as long you will understand how far it has came since its early days. Do you want to play on a low pop server and just try to survive alone? you can do that. Do you want to join a high pop where people are being slaughtered every 2 seconds and be in consant gun fights? you can do that too. The base building is unmatched by any other survival game the constant updates from the devs who actually care about their game is refreshing the amount of user made mods that can be put into a server is amazing. I love this game 10/10 would buy and continue to buy for my friends

review: Product received for free. Graphics Gameplay Community 8/10 7.5/10 5.5/10 Review In my opinion this game is mostly great and should be the example that other developers follow. While I have noticed that the game has slight bugs the developers are very active and always patching them. Along with bug fixes new stuff is constantly being added into the game. In my time playing the game I have come to realise that a part of the Rust community is very toxic and most people just want to ruin your day. Of course I have also met multiple people who have helped me progress through the game and get started. Rust is sometimes about exploring and the developers have done an amazing job making the natural environment look amazing. I recommend this game to people who like PvP and PvE. While you can play this game by yourself I also recommend getting a few friends and playing together it is much more fun that way!

review: The game is great. I enjoy survival games so my review might be a little biased. If you don't like PVP or survival games this is definitely not the game for you. However if you do I fully recommend this game. It has a survival system that isn't too ball breakingly hard but hard enough to where you notice it and tend to your needs. The PVP is sometimes stupid with people who camp on roofs people who just rush nakeds with AK 47s or just times when you shouldn't have died. But there are great points to PVP and that feeling you get when you get your revenge on some salty kids you just sh*t talked you. As far as PVE when going to Launch Site mind the tank. If you hear helicopter blades get inside. Don't try and kill scientists if you don't have the weapons to fight them. And boars bears and wolves are so easy to kill. The game isn't hard but you will have to put time into it. Before refunding it I recommend that you just get to know it. I assume if you put in enough time you'll learn to enjoy it.

review: Om my god what a game. Ive had my ups and downs ive had my quits my wins but this game always has me comming back. This game is not the most polished game but it so fun that it makes up for the rare glitch you encounter. Rust is a game where you really gotta sink time to get good at at one point in your rust lifetime your hyped to get a crossbow then your tired of getting m2's. This game has so much depth and so much content i think it will stand the test of time and with a active developer blog and monthly updates there is usually something new all the time. I even made an alt account just to buy this game on a account without a vacban i cant articulate how much i love this game. The pvp is deep and hard at first the fact that every gun (pretty much) you use was made by you or someone else is such a cool concept i would love there to be a "made by " description on every gun so you can see how many hands it has been in. I cant wait for the future of this game. This is the best open world survival game i have ever played. This game is so charming and i love seeing moments where someone is on the beach and a naked is throwing his rock at him screaming at the top of his lungs its so funny. I have had a wonderful 2khrs (on multiple accounts) and i cant wait to play more.

review: Played RUST in the original Alpha and after 2years without touching it i returned last night.Little break down of my 2 hour stint 1st spawn.Im running naked along the beach bashing the skulls in of the naked sleeping bodies so i can make low grade fuel for a nearby boat also collecting some hemp along the way to make some pants. After getting desired fuel i push the boat out and set off on a journey for the perfect place to call home... Along my sailing i come to what appears to be some idiots crafting gone awol as it appears to be a of tall brick walls blocking my watery path i get closer and end up having to dock my boat as i cant get round them. This is when i realise its not randomly placed structures but a carefully plotted out path to lead me straight into an ambush.Shot with a shotgun point blank range my only bit of clothing stolen left on the floor dying with my and b lls out.2nd spawn This is great i spawn right next to a compound littered with gear. oooo a shotgun with loads of ammo but whats that footsteps? nope just my paranoia getting the better of me. Jump down onto a tug boat to see if theres anymore gear worth grabbing fall into water and get stuck between jetty &amp tug boat. DROWN.Minus my so far bad luck i can say im glad i supported this game in its early development it looks to have come a long way from what it was and im looking forward to putting many new hours into this!

review: The game has been in better states in "my opinion" in terms of the progression system within the game but one thing is sure with this purchase you get your money's worth! I spent 15 on this game back when it came out and after playing it now for over 2400 hours I still play it quite often!It may have issues but for a game to be that cheap and have no ingame transactions other than minor cosmetics its a ing steal!One of my most played games of all time and even after all this time they keep updating it. Every thing from new events to minor loot changes even tho it is not as often as it used to be its still really consistent (first Thursday of every month).At times the devs of the game (FacePunch) can seem disconeccted from it's playerbase in terms of what direction the game is heading in.I have my frustrations wth the game but they do mainly come from me knowing how great the game could be and how great it has been and still is! After having played it for so long I really cant give it anything else then a 10/10 its one of my favorite games of all time but I still hope it gets better as it has it's flaws! If you are looking for a survival game dont look any further as it is currently in my opinion deffininetly the best game within its genre.
title: Rust

review: Product received for free. If you need a fullthrough review you may need to look for someone who spent thousands of hours in this game. If you'd expect me to go through those hours chances are it won't happen to a guy like me who enjoys a different view towards Sandbox games.Yes by definition this is a sandbox game. With the obvious generic elements of survival open world multiplayer stuff that does not hesitate to bring your first few minutes into terror comparable to your first circumcision. If by any means you are afraid of that happening towards you don't waste your money in this game.If you are willing to commit then welcome to the game that will repeatedly crush your hopes and dreams. I would compare this to Rimworld and Dwarf Fortress in terms of it's lack of mercy towards the players but that depends on which servers you'd land on the most part probably the community and official servers. If you obviously wanted to do things solo in this game then you may have to make your own server to do so.As many generic survival games follow you gather resources build your own base and commit to scavenging and developing to become one of if not the best man or woman in the server by having "cutting edge" late game hardware that will dispose anyone whether prepared or unprepared. And by no means creating a crossroads for all players whether they should commit against the unpredictability made by fellow players or toss the game to the bin and call it a day. If you are willing to commit then congratulations you are still far away from being an official masochist.Random events and NPCs generally happen and appear every tick of the clock adding to that already chaotic but vibrant mess that makes things more dangerous but as always taking the risks guarantees a reward alot worth than your grandmother's fake pairs of pearls she normally wears everyday and that's calling the chances of yourself getting something better like a rocket launcher or something worse like nothing. Including the players for that reward? The same variation who knows they might have something you need to satisfy your stats or something even better.But how did this game garnered such a mixed reputation despite a community's "very positive" review? It's a bit weird to say that the game lacks content but to put it more truthfully Rust have definitely rusted itself out pardon the pun.The players are the sole reason the game builted up it's well known standing reputation. Like things in life each individual would begin to prey over the other regardless of their intent. An unwanted achilles heel many games not wanted but nevertheless given by it's players. The unpredictability scale explodes by every player that joins in and that remarkable wanting journey to get everyone the experience they need is only defined by what other people hurl into them. Whether by a charming cuddle of friendship or by no means many's favorite approach a violent swing. The game does not lie about it's basic description and by tossing them phrases similar to that of survival isolation do whatever it takes to survive. Such oversight by players from the game's very truthful description left them doused with frustration and disappointment. But even if one were aware of the nature of this game there is no doubt about many people's answers that everything is the same with or without hardware.How the game runs is okay to say the least. It's one of the few Unity Engine games that doesn't seem to collapse the player's enjoyment in the game for most time but its notorious presence of breaking the game still persists for a few but growing numbers of players. Most would blame the community servers' contents others for reasons of the engine barely optimized or just inconsistent. The music is unneccessary and the sounds are okay as the annoying birds on the balcony. Unless Steam gets the option for players to vote between good and bad this is as far as I can go with this. If you think my review sucks you'd probably be right. But as how Rust goes it's not making it up there well to be relevant but as my experience goes it only works like charm with friends and I have to admit there's still a few more good things to do.

review: This is a great game I truly love it but it does have some issues especially for new players.Gameplay wise the game is excellent. It's easy to start but hard to master. However the only way to play this game is online and most of the community is super toxic. The chances you'll come across a friendly player or even one that won't kos (kill on sight). A giant clan can just come and grief you even if you are a naked with a thatch base. Even if you have nothing but a rock you'll get murdered and laughed at by groups of geared players. They don't care about the loot on your body half the time they won't even check it they just want you dead.The graphics are great and really easy on the eyes. However the game runs like garbage if you don't have a NASA computer. Good luck getting this thing to run on even the best of laptops so you should snag this game only if you've got a good graphics card and ram. However it does run on crappy computers but at about 5 frames a second. There are graphical settings however the graphics really don't change the frame rate unless the setting are ultra high. So this game is great but you're gonna need a good computer to run it.This game's purchasable cosmetics are pretty interesting and cool. In games like counter strike and even the free to play zombie survival game Unturned the in game cosmetics are for weapons and clothing pieces. However in Rust the cosmetics still include Weapons/Tools and Clothing but it also has some cool additions that are unique to the game furniture and building supplies such as bedrolls furnaces and even doors. In my opinion it's a really neat concept for purchasable cosmetics and I look forward to new skins and even new items that can use skins.This game is updated consistently and they're pretty interesting. The major updates can change the way players strategize the game. New tactics can be added with the newest update as of this review electricity as you can now use electricity in traps and in a clan. I believe the game's updates really shape the way the game works and goes to show how commited FacePunch is to this game.In conclusion I believe everyone should at least try this game. It's a great game in my opinion and the people you can meet in this game while rare can be friendly and you can cooperatively work to make a giant base and even recruit more people to your up and coming clan. This game is holds a spot in my heart and I would give it a 9/10.

review: Primitive chat and no dedicated official servers. The servers that are there are supposedly moderated but there is no sign of it when you require assistance. The server i played on was PVE and went to PVP without notice. They also crapped up the rate of decay. In a matter of days my town decayed and i have to start all over again. The community is overall very bad. No one helps each other they just try to raid your house over and over again. It is not allowed on my server but guess what they take no action. Maybe with some dedicated servers and some sensible decay rates this game would be fun to play. Currently though i would stay away unless you like to waste time starting over every few days. Refund!As of late summer 2018 i got banned by the game developer. I was hacked and my account stolen. While they can clearly see my account was hacked and i was not the culprit the ban still holds. This is a scandalous way of doing business innocent until proven guilty clearly is something they have not heard of. Furthermore they have stained my name with this ban and this is against the law. They need to provide proof and they have not done so. Avoid this game developer at all costs!

As a noob and a coward I did what I naturally do when encountering other humans in Rust. I ran. I ran he chased. I stumbled into a hot air balloon fueled it and willed it to fill up quickly. Just as it began to take off my fellow human caught up with me and jumped right in. Luckily for us both it was just a friend! We had a nice balloon ride over the countryside that afternoon and landed in some power lines. 10/10. Every day is an adventure.

review: Rust makes better use of voice chat than any game I've ever played. You are naked and alone on the world's silliest island. There is no narrator or announcer so instead you submerge in the quietude of the unkempt grass crunching beneath your feet as you uselessly smash your rock against the nearest pine tree. Perhaps you've also harvested some mushrooms and a few bundles of flax enough to stave off the hunger pangs and fashion yourself a burlap shawl to cover your shame. If you're particularly industrious you'll have furnished a nice wooden shack a stone's throw away from some fresh water and reliable resources the entry level homestead necessary for any successful Rust campaign.successful Rust campaign.ADVERTISINGBut then you hear it. Faintly at first. Carried on the tip of the breeze. It's another idiot in Rust. I don't know what it is with this game. Maybe it's the fact that you spawn unclothed and uncensored maybe it's the brutal vastness of the design or maybe it's the simple uncouth joy of doing bad things to other human beings but Rust has a distinctly regressive effect on the human species. The voice chat merges with the draw distance so when you're spotted by an idiot you'll start hearing the talk quietly tickling your ear. They get closer they get louder and more confident and suddenly you're hopping over shotgun shells while absorbing an entire dictionary of insults.It's so hilariously antagonistic that I wish I could say I didn't love it. I wish I could say that it didn't feel incredible when one of those naked idiots charged me with their rock and I switched to the battle axe I fashioned out of scrap metal (which he almost certainly didn't know I was carrying) and put him down with a single well placed strike. I wish I could tell you that as I was standing over his fatally wounded body that I didn't laugh my off when my headphones were filled with the voice of a prepubescent boy shouting "Hey man wait a second!" I wish I could say I didn't kill him anyway. No game has ever indulged our lack of humanity quite like Rust and I wish I didn't mean that as an endorsement.If it feels like we've been living with Rust for a long time that's because we kinda have. The game was first released in Early Access in late 2013 by developers Facepunch Studios and it's been a mainstay of goofy YouTube send ups ever since. If you're somehow unfamiliar with the premise think of Rust as a dumber more nihilistic Minecraft. You wake up on a map armed with only a rock and a torch. You quickly figure out that by banging your rock on a few environmental doodads you can harvest a few basic resources (stone wood and cloth) which you can parlay into a few prehistoric instruments like a spear or a hatchet. This is similar to the scrounging mechanics in plenty of other survival games but what makes Rust different is how deep that tech tree goes. Eventually from those same basic ingredients and a few mechanical leaps of faith (like work benches and furnaces) you'll be able to craft pistols flamethrowers and rocket launchers. Rust famously does not quarter off its servers to keep entry level nakeds away from the roving troops suited up in advanced firearms which means that occasionally your journey will end with you matching another player's revolver with a rock that you've tied to a stick.This is the heart of Rust. Wake up naked run for your life do horrible things to one another. There is no grander narrative or mythos or win condition. Most of the servers are on a strict weekly or monthly reset schedule which scrubs the island of any lingering housing or fortifications left behind by the players which gives the experience a strange sense of futility. Yes you will need to manage your hunger thirst and health and as you ratchet up the tech tree you will discover increasingly effective ways to stay alive but that's it. Sure there are some areas on the map that are stricken with radiation which leads to the implication that perhaps you and the rest of your misanthropes are occupying a far flung post collapse society but those moments feel more like window dressing than anything else.I spent the vast majority of my time in Rust playing solo but I don't want to discount the notorious community of players that band together in clans and wage wars of aggression along the shared hunting grounds. One of the fascinating kernels of Rust's brutality is how everything in the world remains persistent even if you're logged off which means that smart players arm their bases with land mines punji sticks and keypad locks while they're away. (Some clans even recruit players across all time zones to make sure there's always someone on guard.) That's a coordination I appreciated from a distance. There are a number of YouTube documentarians showing off the multi man raids that spawn from committed Discord channels all over the world. Instead I engaged with the population of Rust on a purely incidental level. An extremely geared man takes pity on you and drops a crossbow at your quivering feet. That's Rust! A kid and I are raiding an abandoned gas station for food and weapons and I give him the extra pair of pants I was carrying around. When I'm turned the other direction he bashes his rock right through my skull and runs off with the rest of my stuff. That is also Rust.Given the tone it shouldn't be surprising that the community I found in Rust tended to be fairly juvenile and toxic. There's a high concentration of racism and misogyny in the global chat so much so that I eventually left the channel entirely. And unsurprisingly the new player experience is quite prickly. The development team didn't spend any time cooking up a tutorial (which makes some sense when you consider how long the game has been available). Instead when you join one of the many servers you're presented with a few faint hints in the top left corner of the screen "harvest wood!" "build a hatchet!" The crafting system itself is fairly intuitive with well written tooltips for each of the items in the catalog and you can fast track yourself into some serious munitions if you get lucky with a few resource spawns. The PvP combat won't win any awards but it's tactile and packed with wonderfully sadist bone crunching sound effects connecting your hatchet with an idiot's head feels great and really that's all I needed. There is also a strange post release monetization model in which you can buy ugly paint jobs for your weapons and clothing. Rust is fascinating for a hundred different reasons but Counter Strike style weed leaf AWPs isn't one of them. Still though I think everyone should at least have a taste of Rust. It's hard to think of many other games that are this uncompromising in its worldview and I'm utterly entranced with how little faith it has in our ability to get along. We could build a utopia on this island! We could cast aside our weapons and construct a peaceful commune where everyone is fed warm and loved. I love how Facepunch dangles that potential in front of our face with no real incentive pushing us in any direction. If we are to dehumanize ourselves and turn this Eden into a battlefield we will do it on our own terms. In Rust there is a real sense of complicitness when you eventually succumb to violence more potent than in any other survival game on the market. Despite the lack of rankings to chase or K/D to nurture or exclusive vendors to unlock despite the unassailable fact that none of this will matter as soon as the server is wiped we are at war and we always will be.

review: Rust rust rust this game has taken so many of my hours enjoyed most of it. I got this game on humble bundle back in 2016 and have played it on and off with my friend group. The first time I played it me and my friend enjoyed our saturday hunting people down with spears and running around killing people while they scream in voice chat enjoy your first few hours it will never be like that again. Now after another 1.1k hours me and my 4 man group run around on r/RedditMain US and typically get aks and do lots of raids. This is very time consuming though so we only actually try to have a fantastic wipe on 4 day weekends because we are all very busy with life. This game will require you to sacrifice lots of time to enjoy it fully. My experience playing solo it is very difficult and lots of clans will on you no matter where you live. You will enjoy playing solo if you build somewhere away from the main monuments and in the snow you will truly experience the survival aspect of freezing to death because you jumped in a river or being killed by a wolf/scientist with an inventory of sulfur. The game is much more difficult playing solo but if you build away from people you will likely meet other solo players who are friendly with you. Also if you are new people can tell and there will be people who help noobs there will also be people who run around without mics on and killing everyone they see. If you run up to someone and ask how to play they likely will take you under there wing that's what I do when I meet another player. You will experience the full enjoyment of rust the first time you get online raided yes it seems like it sucks but it will be the biggest adrenaline rush you have. The counter raiders the rockets the loot everywhere. I have been doing online raids as well and they are very enjoyable but you likely will not get any loot. Final two things you will be offline raided no matter what and probably will lose your stuff if you off a big group/clan most people do hate clans though but stay on the move and you will move bases more than once. Wiping the server seems dumb unless you play the game I could not imagine a wipeless rust the wipes allow you to all be placed on the same playing field. Overall I love this game and will remember it for a long time I recommend this game the ups and downs are insane you will hate it but love it. It is hard to explain unless you get it. But you should get it. 10/10 worth the price.

review: The game itself its quite fun. There are no "noob" servers for you to play on and the community is Toxic. Though if you play Csgo league or dota you would already be used to this. This game imo is only enjoyable if you play with friends. Playing solo is quite tense unless you play on solo only servers. For those who complain about Lag/Crashes either upgrade your pc or your internet. I have 700 hours on record and not once have i had issues apart from minor frame drops during early access. The best part is the fact that they are always updating the game. Since early access they have been non stop releasing updates. More content for free bug improvements etc. Best survival game.

review: On my main account i have over 600 hours on this game.. At the start it was really fun to play with my friend and when there was a server contest for 20 50 eur we would always win.. Those times were really fun for me and i was addicted to the game. When our favourite server got shut down i took a 3 month break and came back to the game being full of useless updates that don't make the game fun for me at all.. All you do in this game is start with a rock get some wood make a base and then just quit because the game has all these updates that make you grind and be good at the game..Never liked the grinding part of games because i always thought games were meant to be fun. To be honest early access felt like a completed game and in a lot of parts wasn't even broken. All i have to say those 600 hours were the best and the most fun in rust i have had and now that i know i wont ever get 1k hours on this game makes me sad and it's all because of the updates with scientists boats tree minigames that don't work most of the time puzzles. I hope i would be able to go back to 2017 when i started to play the game and had some good fun. Go watch facless's most recent videos on how rust really is meant to be played and you will understand why the community and everything else has ruined the game and how new people usually just refund the game after 30 minutes just because they get killed by an who runs around with a semi rifle near where the nakeds spawn and just kills them over and over just because someone did it to them.. I have only had 1 time i've saw a cheater so i think it's not really infested with them... (subscribe to facless if you already haven't) bye. never playing this game again until they remove the show of updates or make it easier to play.

review: This game can be a lot of fun if you can find a server that fits your playstyle and the amount of time you can commit. There are plenty of modded servers that offer a completely different feel compared to vanilla. I play solo a few hours a week and still enjoy the game on a monthly non bp wipe solo server.Fixes Any BP (blueprint) you can find inside a barrel/crate they need to make default. Why do I have to find a BP for a bear rug or guitar? A solo player has to learn a BP for each item he wants to craft but a group of 5+ players only needs one player to learn it to be able to craft them so groups have a huge advantage over solos. Groups should be forced to research an item or be penalized by the item breaking faster during use. Since they added BP's to the game there is basically NEVER BP wipes on official servers which seems to defeat the purpose of adding them.

review: Who cares about Hot air balloons? Who cares about electricity? who cares about ANOTHER monument. There are so many things broken about this game like the team system Zergs grind the workbench/bp system roof camping and optimization.i Don't think the devs listen to a single thing the community says. who the hell asked for a drivable helicopter? i think the devs should nerf zergs and make guns less valuable so more people run around with them instead of hoarding them in their base.also the amount of scrap you need to get end game gear is a joke. you need almost 1850 scrap to get all the workbenches and 750 scrap for an ak 250 for meds and probably 3000 scrap for everything else. not to mention getting the items to research in the first place is impossible anyone with aks just hides it away or only plays in a zerg and finding one is so rare that you could play 12 hours straight and only have revolvers.even after 2800 hours and being accused of hacking many times this game is simply unplayable without 3 or more players.also i would play solo/duo/trio severs but they are dead and usually modded.

review: This game is very fun although quite toxic. It is a good experience that is quite unique. Although it s also one of those games where you almost need to commit to at least a couple days of your life. That is if you want to have a chance of survival. When you start you will be a nice normal human being. Just after a couple hours you will become a toxic person. As you will be building your base and be so proud. Then inevitably will be blown shy high once you decide that you committed enough time for the day. You will go to sleep and once you wake up you will be upset. You will wake up to your body on the starting shore. You will run back to your base to find they destroyed your sleeping bag and cabinet. And it happened like the middle of the night so everything you put time into is gone. You will sit there and back out of the game for a day. You will restart and this process will continue over and over until you are the top of the food chain causing trauma to other players. But yeah It s a good game.

review: Rust. Its always Rust. Still love this game after all the years. Blood sweat and tears Over 1850 hours over two accounts and I'm still trash. Doesnt run so well on my pc. I honnestly reccommend this game to all those out there. So many different ways to play this game it suits just about everyone. Dont like grinding? you can play modded. like fighting? play battlefield servers. dont like fighting? weirdo. So many options to choose from.I remember when i first bought this game i was still in high school and it was just before the summer holiday i spent everyday playing Rust through the summer ( it was legacy back then) and it quickly rose to my most played game and has held the position since. Many childhood memories have been replaced by memories from rust. Its amazing how i can remember so many different wipes from over the years. Ive run shops traps zergs roleplaying bases and i even was an admin and a chat moderator. I have met so many people and made friends from all countries this game has given me so much and unlike other games this game has been so cheap. ( Rainbow Six and Overwatch in particular) I probably have spent under 35 on this game over all the years and hours ive spent. Whereas ive likely spent around 100 on each overwatch and rainbow six.Anyway try this game. Its provided me with something to do for 6(ish) years.Thankyou Facepunch for unlimited hours of fun for me and my friends. You have put so much effort into this game and we all appreciate it.
title: Rust

review: This game is actually amazing. I know I'm not a "Veteran" of Rust like a lot of other people with thousands of hours but I don't need that much time to be able to tell how good this game is. I know I don't have much playtime yet but I have played 14.5 hrs in 3 days. I know what you're thinking I don't have a life. That is only PARTLY true I still have school and homework and friends and family and I am going into high school so that just goes to show that I took time out of my busy day to play this. It can be a little toxic sometimes but there are still lots of nice people if you just look. Overall this game is worth it. To be honest it is worth sixty dollars or more and I wish there was a deluxe edition or something because I would have bought it. Also if you want good Rust gameplay because you're still unsure about whether to buy it or not check out the youtuber Welyn founder of the Pumpkin Gang! Also check out Enardo he's great too! This took a while to write so I hope it helped! Tell me if it did sway your opinion and sub to Welyn and Enardo!

review: I have played Rust for 6 months total now and have about 900 hours and this is my review based on my experience.WARNING This game is HARD! Note before buying you will die lots. The graphics at maximum are stunning though the game is poorly optimised despite what the developers say as of now. To run it this way at a solid framerate you will need a top end PC. Otherwise you will most likely have to turn down the settings.The audio quality is pristine and the stereo and surround sound is accurate and has a wide variety of settings for different audio configurations. Footsteps are easy to hear which improves gameplay also.The game mechanics are some of the grindiest I've seen although if you have 10 hours a day spare for the game it is worth it. The building is easy to pick up on the gunplay is skill based with recoil patterns and no RNG and the crafting system is simple however the blueprints and workbenches can be a pain to farm for especially for solo players.The community is full of extremely toxic teenagers although there are a few good apples out there. If you can get past that then it is an enjoyable experience.

review: So far can't even get to play the game D Can't get past the queues...wtf DTried royale radiation where the does it comes from which direction...No tutorial nothing. No idea...........maybe I will get to play it eventually but it seems like waiting time 30min 1h to play................................Not much to recommend so far.Connected to community servers hit trees with rock(??) and got one hit from something. AGAIN.Why do people like this.... knows )))**UPDATE**I will leave my old review so it would be visible what was the thoughts from the beginning.So managed to get into game seems more servers are reachable and wait time doesn't exist anymore (no idea why it was previously so...).Game idea is interesting and fun but the mechanics are a bit broken.Basically if you're starting now from fresh (servers get wiped after a while and everyone starts anew) you are running butt naked and trying to survive against people who already progressed and with guns but have no fear you have a rock )) You WILL die multiple times to god knows who or what until you will start to get some grasp of game and if by then you are not frustrated then just wait.... )) Because when you realize that you need some sort of base to continue learning the game and building be prepared to be raided every day even multiple times. Videos online will guide you to how build those bases both small and large but reality is that it won't matter. You will wake up and the place will be raided or someone from a clan sees you and they will raid you within seconds (presumably you can fix walls but you won't make it in 2s to do anything wood or stone doesn't matter). On videos it says it takes more time to go through rock or steel but in reality groups of people can blow whatever you have there within seconds it isn't expensive for them at all even if raiding is not worth they will do it just for the gig. So it definetely caters to grouped players and it will be hard to learn anything as a solo. Disregard those solo videos on youtube to get to that level you will grow gray hair and will have to play like the game is your y spouse not a game to have fun in ) There's more to add but basically....I can't recommend it just because the idea is nice graphics are good and feel of the game itself is attractive the gameplay is pure cancer for a player that plays solo and even if it is more than 5h a day not to mention some casual person....just don't waste time and money.If you would want to start fresh well all of what I said plus other irritations and the fact that you will be up against groups of people and solo people who are much more experienced and will just die endlessly and spawn all over the place for other player amusement. To get to those levels of experience or finding someone you can trust to play with headache that will drain you until you won't even want to play the game itself.If I would need to give marks to the game Graphics 8/10Music 9/10Environment 8/10 (although small maps even those that say are big).Price 3/10 (should be someting like 9.99GBP not much content (comparing to A titles) and it is still ongoing project (as i understand...).Fun 4/10 (it is fun for 2 3 days have 15h of play time since I bought it) But eventually it is more a niusanse than something you want to play on regular basis.So resume is that although I did mentioned to my friends about the game but definetely would not recommend to spend this much money (at least to some) on a product that's just basically mocks you instead of delivering proper value for it's worth.

review: Though my hours are relatively low I've had this game for a good while now. The vanilla servers are pretty sweet the game is much slower and next to impossible without friends to help you as there are loads of teams working together that will shred your very existence at the drop of a hat.There are loads of modded servers as well that imo are where its at.. A good 5x server with a couple buddies can result in some seriously fun PVP raiding base building etc. The survival side of things is very cool. 100% surviving from other players.. Alliances can be made sure but trust no one in any survival game. Not even your best of friends should be 100% trusted. Lock up everything you want to keep.Graphics are great music is sparse but always nice to hear audio is pretty solid. Voice comms are a little wonky but they are obviously trying to make it proximity to feel more realistic. Buy lots of RAM and an 8gb GPU minimum or you'll regret it )

review: Rust is a really competitive and adrenaline rushing game. However I would only recommend this to someone who's willing to take on the stress and time that this game gives and takes away from u. Rust is a game that takes hours out of your day and it keeps you think on whether or not you're getting raided all day. You will go to sleep thinking about all the hours you put in and how u hope nobody offlines you. But you will probably wake up to being raided. And then you will have to restart all over again and keep going. This is the trust on rust and this is what goes through the average player's mind. And this is why i love it. It keeps me on edge and it's really competitive. The community is what creates the game without all the toxicity and KOS rust wouldn't be rust. And that's why i love/hate it in it's moments.

review: This is my favorite game on steam. It is best played with a lot of friends. Me and my friends play this all the time. Its a complicated and competitive game but simple in a way. Pros Big MapsWipes So No One Dominates A ServerTeam Up With People And Raid OthersEasy Crafting SystemGood Graphics (A High End PC Is Best)Up To 200 PlayersImmersive SurvivalCons Server Lag Is Existent (Not Much)Zombies And Bears Make It Hard To Start A New GameTry Hards And Sweats Are EverywhereWipes Happen Too Soon (Depends On Server)RATING 8/10Summary This game is worth it. This review is being made during the lunar sale. 17$ for the amount of content you get is a fantastic deal. No other game can go to the extent this game has. It is truly a fantastic multiplayer survival game that will draw you in for hours and hours. I reccommend you get your friends to play with you. Soloing can be a hard task.

title: Subnautica

review: It's hard to overstate what a magnificent exploration and adventure game Subnautica is.What really stands out to me is that experience not an XP bar but the accumulation of knowledge about the game world its locations and its inhabitants is the most powerful weapon in a player's arsenal.Take Stalkers for example They're the first large predators a player will meet and initially they're annoying and seem quite threatening. An experienced player will ignore them though or at most circle and poke them with a knife to make them go away while at the same time stealing all of their scrap. It helps to have upgraded swim fins upgraded O2 and other advantages but if you took upgraded fins and O2 tanks away from experienced players they still wouldn't have any issues with Stalkers.There's a lot to find and a lot to do in this game. The need to unravel the game's central mysteries and to obtain blueprint fragments salvage and rare materials from wrecks grottoes and strange installations will force you to leave your comfort zone time and again. First you'll crawl out of the Safe Shallows then you'll creep further and deeper then you'll swim further still until one day you'll be amazed at how far away from Lifepod 5 you've gone at the readout on your depth meter and you'll wonder how you ever thought that the seaweed areas just outside of the Safe Shallows were in any way scary.Sustenance is a challenge at first and you'll scramble to get enough food and water but later on they become a matter of management and planning ahead. If you're going on a long expedition you'll want enough supplies to last for the duration but not so many that you can't haul a goodly amount of salvage back to base.As for fiddly stuff you can spend hours building and customizing your underwater habitat customize the look and module loadout of the various vehicles you can build (once you've got the complete blueprints and necessary materials) and have a lot of fun with the wide array of gadgets and Portal/Half Life style "techno guns" the game has to offer. There's a lot of meat there but the true meal lies in exploration.Even at the very end of the game though armed with all the technology you've spent hours pulling out of wrecks and scanning (typically while watching your O2 meter like a hawk and listening nervously to that angry predator thrashing around outside) you'll never feel completely safe or at ease. There are great dangers lying in wait and you'd better hope you spot them on your sonar before their sonar catches wind of you....
title: Subnautica

review: I used to be a SCUBA diver. Can't do it anymore. There are days when I miss it all so bad it hurts. The freedom. The solitude. The Unknown... It's all out there hidden beneath the waves. Subnautica is the game I have been waiting for. In a strange way it feeds the sea hunger inside me somehow. Can't quite explain this sensation without having it sound corny and contrived but that's how it works for me.I stumbled onto Subnautica purely by chance while browsing YouTube gaming clips. Ever seen that *one* game that stops you dead in your tracks? I did. Definitely got my attention as I recall. It was an Early Access release so I could expect all kinds of unforeseen digital weirdness happening inside the game itself. My PC's operating specs were a tad on the light side too but it didn't matter. I wanted that game. Badly.I bought it. I played it. I built things and survived. I enjoyed every minute that I spent 'underwater' again. It's an alien ocean on an alien world. Curiously the sights and sounds around you might seem strangely familiar in spite of the bizarre shapes Life has taken in this place. There is indescribable beauty to be found here side by side with terrible dangers that are either innocently disguised or glaringly obvious. It takes a certain mindset to fully appreciate this world as well as considerable restraint to avoid blindly lashing out at every shadow that flits past your facemask. Remember. YOU are the intruder down there. Take a deep breath and immerse yourself completely. Welcome to Subnautica.
title: Subnautica

review: To anyone reading this This game is best played COMPLETELY BLIND. Don't watch Let's plays don't read the Subnautica wiki. Just start the game.Game? No. Start your journey.This is hands down the best survival game I've ever played.It's also the only survival game that is not just about collecting ressources and building bases. It has more story &amp lore than all other survival games combined.It's story doesn't begin at the end of the game. It's story starts when you load up the game. It's your story. Not the base building keeps you playing but the exploration and the story drives you further.Drives you deeper.Literally.You push deeper and deeper. And everytime you reach a new area you don't feel welcome. Until you explore the area overcome the obstacles &amp problems there. You have to find out what wants to kill you. From your comfort zone into the wild. You make the unknown your new home. You were afraid first. Now you know what to do.You gather new ressources. They allow you to push even deeper.Rince repeat.You're not welcome.Again.I haven't had this feeling in any other game so far. Pushing into the open not knowing what will happen. Not knowing what to expect.My story playthrough took me 50 hours. I had goosebumps way over 50 times. The atmosphere the whole world the animals you meet. It's a stunning world and you're just a small part of it.No lethal weapons. You're on your own. You're weak. A lone survivor on a strange planet. Then you overcome the challenges build vehicles. Survive adapt overcome.This game is absolutely unique and worth every penny.No this game definitely should not be multiplayer. I am glad it has only singleplayer. You are alone. You feel alone.And when you finally find out the planet's secrets... you will know.
title: Subnautica

review: Subnautica is by far the best survival game I have ever played! This game is unlike any survival game. You gather resources and discover technologies to build better and stronger equipment. As you play the game you start to get infected by an alien bacteria. Soon you will find yourself looking for a cure and by doing so you are discovering the misteries of this ocean planet.The visuals are amazing! I couldn't run the game at high settings cuz I only have a gtx1050 but still... WOW! The biomes look spooky and misterious. It just creates this spooky atmosphere.The music is also outstanding! Every biome has its own music. Play with headphones and you will forget about the real world.Then there are the creatures... O man the creatures!The sound design of the creatures is amazing! Just the sound of a reaper in the distance is enough to make me turn around. Not even talking about the gohst leviathan.I strongly recommend EVERYBODY to play this game!Hopefully I haven't spoiled to much about this game!Sorry for bad English. It is not my first language...
title: Subnautica

title: Subnautica

review: Subnautica is quite an experience. I've always been a fan of survival building games and this game can be considered a masterclass in the genre. Everything is very well polished and beautifully designed I have very few gripes about the game. The underwater landscapes are breathtaking and the design of creatures is very inspired. Building the sub known as the cyclops is going to be a gaming moment I never forget. The sheer size the cool factor of the inner workings watching the engine rev up. Such a satisfying progression I'm having a hard time comparing it to any other games.The only negative thing I can think of is that collision detection for entities and walls is not the best at times. I lost a fully upgraded mini sub because it feel into the ground and I could not retrieve it. I would recommend saving often because of a lack of auto save you can just quit and reload if any game breaking bugs happen.Overall subnautica is firmly in my top 5 favourite games. And I will be voting for subnautica GOTY 2018.9.5/10
title: Subnautica

title: Subnautica

review: Subnautica...one of the best games I've played in awhile. Great story game play mechanics and graphics. The devs will not be adding any additional content to this because they are now underway with working on a new stand alone game of Subnautica but will continue to work on bug fixes for the game.You receive a lot of information early on to help point you in the right direction to progress as you explore but what's great for me was you still had to take that information and figure out a lot of what had to be done to futher insure your survival in the game.You start out with just some basic items and have to figure out how gain the things needed to create better equipment to survive and explore farther and deeper.....and deeper you can go.The great varity of Biomes and aquatic life is fantastic and the many different things that can and need to be explored creates a great atmosphere of beauty fun stress and fear.Subnautic does not support MP which for me isn't an issue but for those that this might hold back from trying the game I would say they would be missing out on a great experience.If you've thought about trying it but are still on the fence I highly recommend it and say get it.Just an update....Vote Subnautic for STEAM GOTY...I did and it should be.
title: Subnautica

review: Open world exploration by design pants soiling horror by incident. Blends the concepts of innate human fear of deep water and unknown danger with constant all pervading curiosity.You have to dive deeper. You have to know what's down there.
title: Subnautica

review: (No Spoilers)Subnautica is hands down my best Game of the Year and in my top 3 games I have played in over 25 years of gaming. I absolutely recommend it but be prepared to go on an amazing adventure.This game is immersive and atmospheric absolute beauty matched with moments of terror and humor and a well paced storyline with clues and subplots that lead you into the depths of the game yet let you explore at your own pace. The sounds and music greatly enhance the experience and are a major factor of the game pay attention to the sounds around you! The crafting system is very well done unlocking more levels and enhancements with different areas and just exactly when you need them. Base and vehicle building is also quite well thought out and customization is easy including turning your submarine into a mobile base if you like. Difficulty is also customizable anywhere from permadeath to creative (building without the story). However I would suggest not doing either as your first playthrough. Also as others have said DO NOT watch videos or read guides in your first time through this game. You want to experience it as it was meant to be and you will not get those "firsts" back even though it is still very enjoyable to replay (as shown by my hours played). In the end you will find you have been on a wonderful journey engaging your emotions and mind. Do not be surprised to find yourself emotional at the end. It is a compliment to how well the devs have crafted and paced the story and experience. DO watch through the credits at the end though for Alterra's (and the devs) final joke to the player!
title: Subnautica

review: Subnautica was a game I initially thought seemed pretty basic at first but it still looked fun. So I had just gotten a decent gaming PC and I see it's on sale. I thought that I might as well give it a try and i'd refund it if I didn't. As soon as I started playing I was hooked I never thought something like this would be so appealing as I would explore new biomes and discover new sealife. The feeling of building your first Seamoth and exploring th deeper parts of the game had me so struck with a sense of acheivement. One thing that I never could have expected from the game is how genuinely terrified I was at times like when I heard a Crabsquid for the first time or when I first discovered what lurks in the dead zone. The graphics are beautiful with a unique style to every creature biome and flora.I have never recommended a game more10/10 would die by Crashfish againEdit Now we just wait for Below Zero
